Your browser lacks required capabilities. Please upgrade it or switch to another to continue.
Loading…
The sound of my footsteps, echoing down the long barren hallway, was suddenly the only thing I could hear. Gone were the sounds of screaming and heavy arguing, furniture being pushed over, a sound that I wish to bring back. The silence that had set in was haunting, chilling me to my very core. Every breath I take sends a light shiver through my chest, fading out with the pounding of my heart. I stop and try to compose myself, failing immensely. My parents, they were just having an argument. True, my young ears weren’t accustomed to such thing, but I knew they existed. I take another step forward, and it feels as though the entire house suffers from the weight of my action. Something was very wrong, that not escaping my notice. I was young, yes. I had vivid dreams and a wild imagination that went alongside those dreams nicely, but even I could not merely imagine this. The air of the house was unlike anything I have ever felt. [[Continue on.]] [[Call for my parents from here.]] [[Head back to my room.]]<<nobr>> <<set $daring += 10>> <<audio "prologue" volume 0 fadeto 0.60>> <<endnobr>> I need to see what was going on, with my own eyes. The only way to do that was to continue on. The closer I get to their door, the more I feel a peculiar feeling overtake me. It was as if something was pushing down on me, wishing to bring me to my knees. [[Continue->The Scene]]<<nobr>> <<set $daring -= 5>> <<audio "prologue" loop volume 0 fadeto 0.60>> <<endnobr>> Perhaps calling them now was the safest option, that way I didn’t have to take another step. “Mom? Dad? Are you okay?” The minute the words leave my mouth, I regret them. It was a foolish question. Whether they were making up now or not, the past sounds were evidence enough that not everything was okay. “Is that you dear? Come, we’re sorry that we woke you,” I hear my mother chuckle softly. Despite the soothing words, the tone in which they were said did little to relax my trembling body and racing heart. I think about her words, shrugging my shoulders as I continue towards the door. The closer I get to their door, the more I feel a peculiar feeling overtake me. It was as if something was pushing down on me, wishing to bring me to my knees. [[Continue->The Scene]]<<nobr>> <<set $daring -= 10>> <<audio "prologue" volume 0 fadeto 0.60>> <<endnobr>> I should turn back now. I nod to myself as if reaffirming what I was thinking. I turn on my heel and before I was able to take a full step, I feel a cold wind. “Is that you dear? Come to me,” I hear my mother’s voice command. Despite the soothing words, the tone in which they were said did little to relax my trembling body and racing heart. I chew on the corner of my cheek, the feeling of something being off had only increased. “I’m just gonna go back to bed.” I wait to hear what she would say in response to that. Upon hearing nothing, I continue towards my room. “I said come,” a low growl demands and before I can question it, I feel myself turn, walking back the way I came. I command my feet to stop, I even attempt to fall, but they continue on with a mind of their own. I couldn’t feel them, they were no longer mine to control. [[Continue->The Scene]]I gaze up at the large door, not remembering it to ever be this large in the past. I reach towards it with shaky hands, unsure of what will rest behind it. At this point, my entire body is shaking profusely, I feel as if I will pee myself at any moment. Before I can open it myself, the door slowly swings open on its own accord. I stand in stunned silence. I can feel the onset of an ache as my body remains motionless, fighting only the trembling of my legs. My father’s mutilated body is strewn in every corner of the room. His blood coating both the walls and floors. Some of his limbs and organs are arranged to the side in a perverse abstract sort of way. The only noise originates from my injured mother, a few feet away from me and begging with every fiber left in her body. She opens her mouth when her eyes go wide, a red hue overtaking them, abolishing all color. Her head falls to the side, signaling her death, her mouth remaining open as whatever her last words - whatever they were going to be - remain on the tip of her tongue. I still can’t move, but my body allows itself to shake. A dark shadow rests over my mother’s motionless figure. What I suppose is a leg, is still inserted into her chest. The shadow glares at me, a lopsided cartoonish grin on its face. It was the only sign of a facial expression, as the only other thing on its face were two white dots that symbolize its eyes. [[Attack it.]] [[Question it.]] [[Control myself.]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist -= 10>> <<set $darkburns = true>> <<set $injuries = "third degree burns on arms">> <<endnobr>> Fury, wrath, vengeance. Everything and anything that encompasses the full might of anger becomes my primary focus. I lunge at the creature, but it doesn’t move. I see why when my arms pass through it. I prepare for the rest of my body to follow suit when I’m suddenly frozen, parts of my hands disappeared in whatever mass this creature exudes. At first, I feel no pain. It is as if I had stuck my hands in a hole and I couldn’t yank them back out. But that was at first. I glance up at the creature’s face, that grin still plastered on it. That is when I feel a burning sensation, the feeling of my hands being scorched overcoming me. I yank with all of my strength, but besides having my legs give out underneath me, I get nowhere. I scream and whimper, thrusting around, balling my hands into fists but nothing works. I look back up at the creature. Its mouth is gone, and its glowing white eyes have turned a pale red. It leans down, so it’s closer to my face. “Now what did you think you’d gain from doing that?” it questions, cocking its head to the side in an unnatural way. It says such words as if the thought of the action honestly hurt it. Words form in the back of my throat but never move past that point. Whether it was the shock of watching my parents die, or because of the pain of my hands feeling as if I stuck them in a boiling pot of water, I am unable to utter a single sound. “Friends don’t attack each other,” it coos into my ear, its breath stinging my neck. Its words help me find my own. With tears leaving their trails down my face, I glare at it. “You killed my parents. You’re a monster. Not my friend!” It comes even closer, its face directly in front of mine as it searches my eyes. “You invited the monster.” It continues to stare at me, my heart aching at everything that I had experienced in the last thirty minutes. = false>> <<set $lp = false>> <<set $ep2unlock = false>> <<set $ep3unlock = false>> <<set $ep4unlock = false>> <<set $ep5unlock = false>> <<set $ep6unlock = false>> <<set $ep7unlock = false>> <<set <<cacheaudio "darkness" "audio/darkness.mp3">> <<cacheaudio "ball" "audio/pryceball.mp3">> <<cacheaudio "mind" "audio/fogsofthemind.mp3">> <<cacheaudio "blues" "audio/blues.mp3">> <<cacheaudio "ambiance" "audio/morningmeadow.mp3">><<nobr>> <<set $pacifist += 10>> <<set $darktruth = true>> <<set $injuries = "deep scar on cheek">> <<endnobr>> “Why? Why would you do this?” It cocks its head to the side in an unnatural angle. “Why do any of us do anything? Because we are merely puppets to our masters.” “What does that even mean!” I scream in anger and confusion. “I wouldn’t expect a child to understand, but one day you will. And I’ll be there to help guide you every step of the way, my friend.” [["No, you won't!"]] [["I still don't understand."]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist += 10>> <<set $darkcontrol = true>> <<set $injuries = "bruise scar over heart">> <<endnobr>> I take multiple deep breaths, attempting to calm both my mind and body. I open my eyes and the trembles return, everything I had just done was for not. It continues to gaze at me, trying to figure out what I was doing. It comes over to me and places a delicate finger on my heart. “It's. Still. Thumping.” With every word it taps my heart harshly, sending a tremor through my body. When it finally removes its finger, I press my hand to my heart. Whatever it did - it left a burning mark. [[Continue->Running Away]]“No, you won’t. I created you and I can make you disappear.” It lets out a hearty laugh and turns to me fully, leaving my mother’s body behind. It takes a threatening step towards me and I clench my eyes closed, commanding it to go away. I open them, but it is still stalking towards me. “Go away,” I shout, repeating what I had done before. It grows closer. “I said go –” Before I can scream the sentence, it appears in front of me, its height and presence engulfing me. It grabs my jaw, one of its claws digging deep into my cheek as it tightens its grip. “Go away? Go away! You think you can command me! You stupid child. I am not your mere imagination, here for your pleasure.” Tears sprinkle my eyes as everything that has happened catches up to me. Confusion racks my body, and I fall to my knees, sobbing. [[Continue->Running Away]]“And you won’t, for a long time.” It lets out a bored sigh and turns to me entirely, leaving my mother’s limp form behind. It takes a step towards me, and I take one back, not knowing its intentions. “Tell me something. What am I supposed to do?” “Nothing that you haven’t been doing. Your parents were just in the way you see, they needed them gone.” It grows closer. “Who are they?” Instead of answering, it appears in front of me, its height and presence engulfing me. It grabs my jaw, one of its claws digging deep into my cheek as it tightens its grip. “So many questions. Wouldn’t you rather take this time to grieve?” Tears sprinkle my eyes as everything that has happened catches up to me. Confusion racks my body, and I fall to my knees, sobbing. [[Continue->Running Away]]“But why?” I question, my gaze dashing from one corner to another as more ghostly shadow figures join the lone one. I shiver tremendously, feeling the presence of a dark figure coming up on my back. I suppress the whimper forming in the back of my throat and clench my eyes closed, opening them a moment later. My eyes widen, shocked to see the room completely empty of the dark figures, and the shadow that I once thought was a friend. Before I can further react to this, questioning their whereabouts and intentions, something grabs my ankle. I scream, jumping out of my skin to see my mother’s glazed over eyes locked on mine. “Run.” She barely finishes the word before a series of loud pitched screams erupt from behind me. [[Do as she says, run.]] [[Glance behind me.]]<<nobr>> <<set $stubborn -=10>> <<endnobr>> I didn’t need to be told twice. The adrenaline kicks in and I race out of the room, refusing to look back. The mix of roars, shrieks, and moans tell me that my decision was wisely made, and I continue on. [[Continue->Running Away2]]I’m frozen in my spot due to my curiosity and want to know what was going on. My inquisitiveness overrides my mother’s dying words and my own primordial instincts. I look over my shoulder and see dozens of skeletal bodies attempting to break through the wall as if it was elastic. Different limbs try to break the barrier at all times, but the wall moves with them, never allowing them freedom. And then suddenly, the wall goes back to its normal state, but the figures surge forward, each reaching for me with gaping mouths. [[Continue->Running Away2]]I fly down the hall, attempting to navigate my darker than usual home. I once felt nothing but complete solace behind these walls. I can easily remember coming home from stressful childhood school days, smelling the aroma of meatballs as I paraded through the door, being free for another day. I zoom past a window just in time to see the small playground set that I helped my father build. The joy I had once experienced once we had finished it evades me now, blocked by my need to escape to safety. “Where will you run?” I hear the lead shadow figure scream in rage, the figures shooting out of the walls, their mouths dripping with blood. They smell of rotten eggs and spoiled garbage, their smell polluting the house. I attempt to push past it, but the smell brings water to my eyes. Shock begins to set in, and I feel my energy wane greatly. “There’s the door,” I hear it mock, and some unseen force begins to swing the door back and forth. [[Go for the door.]] [[Go for a window.]] [[Go for my room.]]I pick up my pace, it was right, the door was right there. I can make it, that’s all I have to do. I just have to make it. I feel like I’m about to trip, trying my hardest to make it there. Suddenly my mother appears before me, her arms open wide as I run straight into her embrace. The smell is gone, the feeling of complete desperation and horror is lifted. I hear birds outside, and I glance around to see that it’s an average day. “Shh, bad dream?” she questions. She draws back and cocks her head slightly to the side, wiping away the tears that fall down my cheek. “It was awful,” I scream at her, and she rubs my back in soothing circles, rocking me back like she always does. Her embrace is warm, and I feel myself melt into it, wishing for her to never let me go. “It’s okay, it’s over now. No more bad dreams, no more bad dreams,” she continues to say this gently. Not before long she stops, a cold, stale wind setting in and her soothing rubs turn to aching scratches. I know what has happened, I know my fault and the trick that was played on me. “There’s the door,” I hear her growl in my ear, my hair raising. I feel myself sinking, being dragged down by a hundred different slimy hands all at once. They cling to the fabric of my clothing, tugging and stetching the material. They call for me, telling me that this was always meant to be, this is my fate. Darkness begins to impede my vision of the door, still swinging as if to mock me. [[Season One]]I suddenly turn direction, heading for the closest window which happened to be nearby. The door is a trick, nothing but more torture awaits me there. I pick up my pace. I can make it, that’s all I have to do. I just have to make it. I feel like I’m about to trip, trying my hardest to just make it – and I do. My hands fidget with the window locks, clumsily trying to unlock them as the pressure surrounding me escalates. “Are you fast enough?” I hear a mocking voice ask, and against my better judgment turn to see all and any form of light fade from the hallway, the darkness encroaching. I turn back and with a steady breath unlock the rest of the locks. I push the window up as far as I can, clawing at the window screen. The voice repeats its words, getting closer and closer to me. But I can make it. I tear a big enough hole in the screen for me and begin to hoist myself out, right as a figure shoots up. A non-discernible shape overwhelms me, its hands clasping around my neck. “You’re not real,” I try to persuade myself, and as if hurt by my words, the figure’s grip tightens. It crawls through the small hole in the screen, one lean leg after another, and then its body follows. It does this all while keeping me firmly in its grasp, its actions causing the shock to build up, threatening to cause me to faint. It stands at full height, its eyes boreing into mine. It cocks its head a full ninety degrees and continues to stare. “Not real!” it suddenly blurts, its mouth opening in ways that no normal jaw would allow. “Do you hear this. We’re not real!” Its head bounces from one side to the other as if trying to laugh but not knowing how. Its actions come to a grinding halt, and it leans its face mere inches away from mine. “You’re lucky I can’t kill you.” Before I can question what it means, I feel myself sinking, being dragged down by a hundred different slimy hands all at once. They cling to the fabric of my clothing, tugging and stetching the material. They call for me, telling me that this was always meant to be, this is my fate. Darkness begins to impede my vision of the window, parts of the screen flapping frivolously in the wind, bidding me goodbye. [[Season One]]I suddenly turn direction, heading for my room instead. The door was a trick, nothing but more torture waited for me there. I pick up my pace. I can make it, that’s all I have to do. I just have to make it. I feel like I’m about to trip, trying my hardest to just make it. Maybe this was all a dream, brought on by my shadow friend. My room could make this all go away, hiding underneath my covers and counting to ten like my father told me too. The hallway seems to extend, getting longer and longer, the door to my room always drifting just out of reach. Perhaps I’ll never make it, a thought that repeats on loop, until my hands clasp around the cold knob. In one fluid motion, I throw my door open, close it behind me, and lock it. I practically jump onto my bed and under the covers, hugging myself as I begin to count. I reach for my teddy, a constant reminder of my youth and the fear that something is always lurking within the confines of my room. The noises from outside grow louder, their fetid odor invading my room. No matter, I continue to count, my voice trembling and my head aching. “Nine. Ten.” Everything is silent. The smell is gone, and I no longer hear the moans of the damned outside my door, clawing to get in. My body continues to shake uncontrollably, even though my brain tries to signal everything to calm down. I remove the blanket, jumping at the black figure and the crystal white eyes that glare back at me once I do. “You’re mine,” it exclaims and surges towards me, hands gripping my shoulders. I feel myself sinking, being dragged down by a hundred different slimy hands all at once. They cling to the fabric of my clothing, tugging and stetching the material. They call for me, telling me that this was always meant to be, this is my fate. I clench my eyes closed in terror, counting, again and again, to clear it all away. Desperately searching for my teddy bear, knowing that the stuffed animal will forever be kept out of my reach. [[Season One]]<<link [img[images/title.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/quote.png]] >><</link>> @@.center; <h2>Episode Navigation</h2> @@ [[Episode One: No Good Deed]] <<if $ep2unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Two: Abandoned]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep3unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Three: Charmed]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep4unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Four: Who Let the Dogs In]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep5unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Five: Wanted]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep6unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Six: Eye of the Roe]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep7unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Seven: Bladenboro Beast]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep8unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Eight: For the Crown]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep9unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Nine: Life Without Parole]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep10unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Ten: The Thing About Safehouses]] <</if>>\ <<if $ep11unlock is true>>\ [[Episode Eleven: Highway to Hell]] <</if>>\<<nobr>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<set $nerve -=50>> <<endnobr>> <<link [img[images/epone.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> “And then what happens?” I finally raise my gaze to look at the woman sitting stoically in front of me. I had to commend her for the brave face she was wearing, it was almost believable. Yet, I have seen far too many therapists to know that she was just as freaked out as everyone else I’ve been ‘suggested’ to see. “Nothing ... I woke up after that.” I gaze down at my fingers again, twiddling my thumbs as the images of the dream leave my mind. “And this specific dream? Do you have it often? Exactly the same way?” “No, more comes back to me each time I have it like it’s not just a dream.” “Well that’s the thing, it is just a dream. Your brain is just adding more to it each time.” “But I thought dreaming wasn't lucid?” “It can be lucid, but most of the time it isn't. We dream of something random with minor importance and don't even remember it when we awake. But we can also train our brains to dream of certain things, and they can get pretty vivid sometimes. It seems like whether you like it or not, your brain is trained to keep adding to this horrific story. When was the last time you had this dream? Not counting the most recent of course.” I shake my head, trying to recall the last time I suffered from this dream, “um, four or five years ago I think.” “Right when you started college,” she points out and nods her head while writing something down, “perhaps this dream is brought on by stress?” <<if $darkburns>>\ “Then why does the dream explain how I got this?” I question and hold up both of my hands to show her the now healed markings. The skin of my hands and forearms was severely lighter than my true tone, and from a distance, one would just think that I was wearing long gloves. “Your records show that you were severely burned in a house fire, the same one that killed your parents. Perhaps this is your brain’s way of coping with this information.” I let out an exasperated sigh, shaking my head and leaning back in my seat. But she was right. I remember the fire, the feeling of passing out as the flames licked my skin, the smell of acrid smoke. <</if>>\ <<if $darktruth>>\ “Then why does the dream explain how I got this?” I question and point to the scar that rests on my jaw. Even though it has healed, it was still a deep enough scar that it remained a haunting dark red shade. At times, I would forget that the scar still rested there, and I paid for it when I accidentally scratched and found a deep gully on the side of my face. “Your records show that you had an accident, you slipped and fell on exposed metal. It says that the cut was gravely infected and almost killed you. Perhaps this is your brain’s way of coping with this information.” I let out an exasperated sigh, shaking my head and leaning back in my seat. But she was right. I remember the event, the feeling of the metal slicing through my skin as I clutched my jaw in horror. <</if>>\ <<if $darkcontrol>>\ “Then why does the dream explain how I got this?” I question and point to my heart, knowing that she had seen pictures of the wound. Residing in different areas of my heart were three circle wounds, resembling those of bullet holes. It looked as if something had tried to mine its way to my heart but failed and only caused cracks to occur. “Your records show that you were caught up in an unfortunate drive-by from a local gang, it says you were shot three times, your parents were killed. Perhaps this is your brain’s way of coping with this information.” I let out an exasperated sigh, shaking my head and leaning back in my seat. But she was right. I remember the event, the sounds of gunshots ringing in my ear, the panicked screams from everyone nearby. And that quiet yet oh so clear sound of my heart slowing, the beats fading with every loud thrum. <</if>>\ [[Continue->NGD1]]<<nobr>> <<set $syderolist = false>> <<endnobr>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<link [img[images/eptwo.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> <<if $uncledead>>\ I walk an unfamiliar path through even more unfamiliar woods. The sky is blocked out by towering skeleton trees. Though they hide no secrets, I feel as if invisible eyes watch me from their gangly branches. They guide me forward, moaning horribly whenever I wander from the path. This is a dream, that much I knew. Yet how to wake myself eludes me. I continue on. I turn a corner and see a figure covered in branch-like limbs. They twitch, and the sound they make makes it seem like they are breaking under unseen weight. [[Call out to the figure.]] [[Throw something towards it.]] [[Approach it.]] <<else>>\ Six crows stare down at me from their barren perches. Life resides all around us, but the tree that they chose was dead and has been that way for some time. Desolate branches cling to the tree’s trunk, some lay limp on its side, the last fibers connecting it. It was a peculiar sight. A forest filled with life, birds chirping and frogs croaking in the distance. But here, here sat six crows whose glares were fixed on me. I walk from one place to another, seeing if they were just frozen or if they were actually looking at me. My thoughts answered when their gazes follow my actions. I turn around, half expecting to see a scene like last time. I knew this was a dream. This dream state screamed the truth at me but how to wake up eludes me. No one is behind me. No one else exists, just me and the six crows. [[Throw something at them.]] [[Question them.]] [[Walk away.]] <</if>>\<<nobr>> <<set $bedmoment_Sydero = false>> <<set $bedmoment2_Sydero = false>> <<set $bedmoment_Chris = false>> <<set $justcoffee = false>> <<set $hunterready = false>> <<unset $syderolist, $snitch, $gagged>> <<endnobr>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<link [img[images/epthree.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> <<if $cp>>\ //Two Years Ago,// I reside on the edge of my bed, flipping through pages of my textbook as I try to figure out what’s important, and what isn’t. It would be my luck to have gotten a professor whose distaste for technology rivals that of her disfavor for millennials. “You kids are slaves to the devices in your hand,” I mimic her most treasured line in class as I search for the answer to the discussion post. “Knock knock,” I hear Chris’s voice, and give him permission to enter. I raise a brow at his sprightly attitude and wonder if he finally got the courage to ask that one girl out. “Guess what, $name!” Part of me didn’t wish to entertain him, he would tell me either way so what did it matter? [[“What?”]] [[Silently stare.]] [[Guess.]] <<else>>\ //One Year Ago,// "What the hell is the matter with you?" I hear a commanding voice ask. His voice carries well into my room, each word reverberating off the walls. If there is a response, I can't hear it. "I paid for your ass to come here, and this is what you do? You don't even know what you're studying! I didn't send you here to waste my money on fraternity bullshit and bartending." Seeing that my desk was close to the door, it was unbelievably tempting to just open it up more, if only to hear the responses. And so I do just that. "This is my life, I'd be damned if I don't spend it the way I want," I hear Chris reply and following it is the all too familiar sound of flesh hitting flesh. "Watch your mouth," I hear his mother say. Silence sets in after that, but after a few seconds, I barely make out the voice of who I suspect to be Chris's father. "Listen here, boy, you're way to smart too be spending your time doing stupid things. You're going to graduate and get a good job, enough of this childish shit. You hear me?" "Get out," I hear Chris growl. "What did you just say to me?" "Get out! Before I call campus police," he shouts. His shout causes me to jump, unprepared for the ferocity behind it. I peer into the living area of our suite to see his father grumbling, stalking towards the door, and out. "You know better than to talk to your father like that. What has gotten into you?" his mother asks next, following the same path as her husband. She sees me eavesdropping and gives me a sorrowful look, quickly scurrying out. Chris is the next to appear in my view, locking the door before resting his head on its cool surface. [["That sounded like it went well."]] [["Your dad sounds fun."]] [["What was that all about?"]] <</if>>\<<nobr>> <<unset $bedmoment_Sydero, $bedmoment2_Sydero, $bedmoment_Chris, $justcoffee, $hunterready>> <<set $sydfaerie = false>> <<set $kitchen = false>> <<set $gastrap = false>> <<endnobr>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<link [img[images/epfour.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> This decision was a matter of life or death. A decision that could tear apart countries, break up families, start a never-ending war. What to eat? I was exaggerating the depth of my choice, but that didn’t mean it wasn’t important. “Will you just order something?” Sydero growls, her gaze moving from me to the patiently waiting waitress. If we didn’t have a crowd, I would give Sydero a piece of my mind. Mainly due to me being hungry, but the other half was because I had forewarned her of my indecisiveness. I was still looking over all of the possibilities, as well as the prices. <<if $cp>>\ “What did you get, Chris?” I question, noticing that he was also giving me an undecipherable look, if I had to name it I would say it was annoyed empathy. “A salad.” “Why order something that won’t fill you up?” Sydero questions. “It does fill you up, and it’s healthy. Healthier than your double-decker bacon burger.” “Just hearing it said aloud makes me hungry,” she smirks, “what? Are you trying to watch your figure?” “I am, actually.” "Whoa," I start, raising my hand to pause their conversation, "when did this whole 'watching my figure' thing happen? You live for junk food." "It started when I started getting kidnapped by werewolves and having to rethink my entire life," he said pointedly, and I let him have it as Sydero raised another question that morphed into another argument. “Alright, thank you both.” I close the menu, finally knowing what I want. That, and the waitress was still standing there while these two fought. The last time they argued, I had to explain to the gas station clerk what they meant by faeries and human sacrifices. <<else>>\ “You make it seem like this decision isn’t important,” I tell Sydero who seems ready to pound her head on the table. “I’m as hungry as you, Roe, just pick something before I die.” “What did you order?” “If I tell you, will it make you order faster?” I shrug, and she groans heavily. I look back at my menu, considering it before finally knowing what I want. I close it and glance at Sydero who visibly perks up, along with the waitress. <</if>>\ “So, you know what you want?” the waitress asks, shaking out what I can only assume is a cramped hand. [[Get the salad.->WLD1]] [[Get a burger.->WLD1]] [[Get a vegan burger.->WLD1]] [[Get chicken tenders.->WLD1]] [[Get some vegan pizza.->WLD1]] [[Get a chicken wrap.->WLD1]]<<nobr>> <<unset $sydfaerie, $kitchen, $gastrap, $answer1, $virginquestion>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<endnobr>> <<link [img[images/epfive.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> The stench of death lingers in the air, a smell that drew both pleasant and unpleasant memories from Raum. He’s been on battlefields where death clung to the astral veil, ripping at it and demanding to set the land asunder. This was nothing, an unfortunate sideshow part of an otherwise much larger act. They had arrived at the shed not too long ago, his men immediately going to work trying to find evidence. Him hoping that his personal werewolf could pick something up, anything. But each passing minute told him that what he searched for was long gone. It had left its handiwork behind before fleeing. “We lost the trail boss,” Petri states, the only words Raum didn’t wish to hear at the moment. “Nothing but dead bodies and some organs everywhere,” Langston adds in next. Perhaps that was why the smell had remained for so long. Raum straightened himself, not seeing the point in staying any longer. “But,” Petri starts, motioning for him to follow, “there is one thing you might find interesting.” Petri leads the group into the shed, much to Raum’s dismay. He’s seen worse, smelt worse, and done worse with his own hands. But that didn’t mean he was in the mood to dwell on such things. The sharp smell of pine abandons him, replaced by a sweet fetid smell. The smell of death was always the worst part of the job to him, the worst part of anything really. It reminds him of a million different rotten and foul smells, all conjoining at once to exist in the same place. He could deal with the sight, the feeling, the act ... but never the smell. It was why he left a scene quickly, leave the mess for another. Petri stops at a dead werewolf body, moving the sheet that they had rested over him down. The sheet was Langston’s idea, Petri’s was to throw the bodies on the nearest pyre. He felt no sympathy or connection to those that laid dead around him. He was a lone wolf, had seen to that personally when pack life didn’t match his own ambitions. Raum offered him something no pack could, invulnerability. Throw that in with an uncaring attitude for when he hunted a human, and Petri’s loyalty was laid at his feet. [[Continue->W1]]<<nobr>> <<set $explorehouse = false>> <<set $shower = false>> <<unset $wrongname, $leftwork, $morgancuddle, $morgannight, $morganfling, $break>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<endnobr>> <<link [img[images/epsix.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> The doors of the abandoned house were thrown open, the knob thudding up against the wall, causing the noise to echo through the entire house. It was another safehouse of Syd’s though I still had trouble believing it. The house in question is nestled in a large clearing in the woods. The white vertical boards making up the exterior part of the house weren’t completely clean, but I could tell that they were white. Some had minimum damage, and others looked as if they were still being maintained. The house sat upon a multicolored stone foundation, and the porch held railings that went around the majority of the house. I had expected the inside to look worse but was pleasantly surprised. It wasn’t the most attractive home, but it was nothing like Sydero’s other safehouses. A few dirty furniture pieces decorate the rooms, and the walls showed no sign of wear. The same thing couldn’t be said about the floor, and though I wouldn’t walk around with my bare feet, I would sit on the ground without fear. <<if $cp>>\ “This doesn’t look half bad,” Chris points out, trailing his hand down the wall, showing me his clean palm. <<else>>\ “This doesn’t look half bad,” I point out, trailing my hand down the wall and seeing a clean palm. <</if>>\ “This is my main safehouse, that’s the only reason it doesn’t look like shit,” Sydero grumbles, heading towards a tipped over lamp and righting it. “Thoughts on the electricity, Bradley?” I look for the kid but am unable to find him, until I see him to the side, busy on his computer. “I can try to check the meter boxes, if not then I can try and see what I can do based off of what’s in the area. If I can't pull electricity in from somewhere else we might be out lof luck. Might take me a while too, and I’ll have to get to it after I finish my current project.” I raise a brow, “what’s your current project?” “I’m trying to see if I can make your college debt disappear,” he smirks, fluttering his fingers in the air as he says it. <<if $cp>>\ “Bradley, have I ever told you how much I love you?” Chris questions, wiping away an imaginary tear. “No, and don’t start, please.” <</if>>\ [[Continue->ER1]]"If I may ask, during these dreams do you ever find yourself facing a certain fear? [[Continue->NGD2]]I head to my car, allowing her words to replay over in my head. Could it be possible that her words held truth? These dreams were rare yet horribly ironic, every time I begin to forget about them, the dream extended itself as if to remind me of its validity. I begin to fumble with my keys. She could be onto something, this could just be my mind’s way of dealing with all the trauma I’ve faced. Anything else made little sense, especially seeing what my dreams consisted of. The only element that was in my dreams that I know is real is the shadow entity. But wasn’t that always my imagination? Was I falling back on the image of it to further visualize my inner pain? I finally unlock the car I was slowly approaching. If the world was working against me, then this gift was one of the only things that hadn’t. [[I drive a Dodge Challenger.|NGD2_1][$car = "Dodge Challenger"]] [[I drive a Ford F-150.|NGD2_1][$car = "Ford F-150"]] [[I drive a Honda Civic.|NGD2_1][$car = "Honda Civic"]] [[I drive a Jeep Wrangler.|NGD2_1][$car = "Jeep Wrangler"]]Ever since my world came crashing down, my uncle has been there for me. He had long since lost his child and wife due to birth issues. After that, I didn’t see him as much. I faintly remember my father stating that no one saw much of him, he locked himself away. He turned to drinking but it didn’t last long, my father was there to help him – we were there to help him. He was the first to envelop me in a hug after what happened. We were there for him when he lost his family members, and now he was there for me. He took me in, and though the next few years were hard, he helped me through. [[He reminded me of my purpose for living.]] [[No matter how much I fought him, he never gave up on me.]] [[He refused to let me carry the entire weight.]]<<nobr>> <<set $oncesuicidal = true>> <<set $optimistic +=10>> <<endnobr>> They were dark days, and at times I felt like I wasn’t going to be able to make it. Everything had happened all at once, and no matter how hard I sought it, I couldn’t catch a break. I withdrew within myself and with fangs bared, told everyone to stay back. But he was stubborn, he refused to. He didn’t back down, and he never let me forget my importance. [[Continue->NGD2_2]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist -=10>> <<endnobr>> They were dark days, and in response, I lashed out as if I was a primitive being. He caught the brunt of it, being that I lived under his roof. I did what I wished and cared little for the consequences. I pushed his buttons and dared him to retaliate. He never did, but he also didn’t back down. He punished me, and after a while of us dancing, I finally stopped fighting him and others. [[Continue->NGD2_2]]<<nobr>> <<set $stubborn +=10>> <<endnobr>> They were dark days, and at first, I forgot that like me, he had lost someone important as well. I was selfish with my pain and rightfully so. My parents were ripped from my grasp at such a young age and in such an unfair way. But he lost his brother, a brother he grew up with and knew all of his life. A brother he watched graduate, get married, and have a kid. And though I was selfish, depriving him of his grieving at times, he never held it against me. He helped me the entire way, and I knew that if anyone knew where I was, it was him. [[Continue->NGD2_2]]Through middle school and high school, it was our combined strength that kept me going. Graduating high school was a feat in itself, something many thought I wouldn’t be able to accomplish, in a way not even I did. I was a broken teen with a mounting amount of issues. And I pushed myself, I forced myself to do extra activities to get my mind off of it all. I thought that the more I do, the less I would remember. The less the dreams would come, and I would be safe behind a barrier of stressful foolhardiness. Despite my best intentions, the stressful load got the better of me and stopped nothing. The pain kept coming, the dreams still bothered me, and my teachers did not let up. But regardless, I learned skills and formed new hobbies. [[Creative Arts.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Creative Arts"]] [[Nursing.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Nursing"]] [[Education.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Education"]] [[Law or Criminal Justice.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Criminal Justice"]] [[Exercise Science.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Exercise Science"]] [[Communications.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Communications"]] [[Psychology.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Psychology"]] [[Computer Science.|NGD4][$cmajor = "Computer Science"]]<<nobr>> <<if $cmajor is "Creative Arts">> <<set $creativity += 20>> <<set $perception +=10>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Nursing">> <<set $medical += 20>> <<set $charisma +=10>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Education">> <<set $charisma += 20>> <<set $perception +=10>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Criminal Justice">> <<set $combat += 20>> <<set $perception +=10>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Exercise Science">> <<set $athleticism += 20>> <<set $medical +=10>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Communications">> <<set $creativity += 10>> <<set $charisma +=20>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Psychology">> <<set $medical += 15>> <<set $charisma +=15>> <</if>> <<if $cmajor is "Computer Science">> <<set $engineering += 10>> <<set $technology +=20>> <</if>> <<endnobr>> I drive to my place of employment, trying to occupy my mind with anything but the words of my therapist. Instinctually, I turn into my usual parking spot, claimed by me all but physically over the past two years of me working here. I freeze, my foot slamming on the breaks as I eye the car that resides there today. After the initial shock wears off of having my parking spot stolen, I finally will myself to find another. [[Let it go.]] [[Check to see if I recognize the car.]] [[Key whoever's car it is.]] [[Go inside and ask about it.|NGD4_1][$stubborn +=5]]<<nobr>> <<set $sympathy +=10>> <<set $stubborn -=5>> <<endnobr>> The driver probably saw the empty spot and, without thinking, took it. [[Continue->NGD4_1]]<<nobr>> <<set $carcheck = true>> <<set $sympathy -=5>> <<endnobr>> For all I know the driver was a guest, quickly finding a spot since they were going to be in and out. Though I guess that didn’t make me feel much better either, seeing that these spots were employee only. I decide to check the car, hoping I can recognize it. It was a pretty blue Ford Fusion with an unrecognizable license plate from another state, no blemishes whatsoever. The inside was tidy with nothing but a pair of large fluffy white dice hanging from the rearview mirror to help me discern whose car it was. I finish my inspection, concluding that I’ve never seen the car. But I knew someone who probably would have. [[Continue->NGD4_1]]<<nobr>> <<set $keycar = true>> <<set $sympathy -=10>> <<set $daring +=5>> <<endnobr>> I get out of my car with a determined look in my eye. I stalk towards the vehicle, inconspicuously trailing my key along the side harshly as I continue to walk forward. I stop before getting to the passenger’s side door, whistling to myself and pocketing my keys with a devilish grin. The asshole shouldn’t have taken my spot, I don’t care who they are. [[Continue->NGD4_1]]<<nobr>> <<set $ChrisRichardson = true>> <<endnobr>> I head inside and go to clock in, listening to the daily dose of drama that my co-workers always had to share. Most of it was about crazy ex’s, pregnancy, upcoming parties, and finals. Everyone at The Alley was either a college student, college dropout, or simply had enough common sense not to go to college. They made for interesting conversation on the best of days, other times it was a minor distraction to take away from the crappy tips and rude customers. The Alley was a small amusement park complete with a bowling alley, skating rink, mini-golf area, laser tag, bumper cars, bouncy house, and then arcade areas. There was a total of two restaurants here, not counting the room for private parties and birthdays. There were also two bar areas, one inside near the bowling section and another near the outdoor pool. It was a popular tourist attraction as well as a hotspot for the young and old in the town. And with summer fast approaching, our days would only get longer and harder. [[It was a great job, not a career choice, but I loved it nevertheless.->NGD4_2]] [[It was a decent job, good pay and company but that was about it.->NGD4_2]] [[I hated the job but I needed it so what can I do.->NGD4_2]] [[I was indifferent about the job, I showed up, worked, and went home.->NGD4_2]]As if my legs had their own mind, I head to the pool area to where my close friend Chris would be. And sure enough, when I arrive, he’s there vaping with a few of our other co-workers. Unsuprisingly he's bopping his head to some imaginary beat, and when I get closer I hear him murmuring the lyrics, "rock 'n' roll ain't noise pollution. Rock 'n' roll ain't gonna die." He finally sees me and immediately perks up, grinning like the Cheshire cat. “Did you hear? We’re on outdoor bar duty. Those tips are about to be rolling in.” <<if $optimistic < 50>>\ “That’s if we don’t get the lousy folks.” “Try to keep that pessimism at bay. Today we’re all about million-dollar smiles and perky attitudes.” “Sure. Any idea whose car that is in my spot?” <</if>>\ <<if $optimistic >= 50>>\ "That's great news. If we're lucky, we'll get a few older folks and a whole lotta college aged tourists." "Right, these are the moments I live for," he exclaims. I shake my head with a smile. "By the way, do you know whose car that is in my spot?" <</if>>\ “Someone’s in your spot?” he asks, seeming as shocked as I. Like me, Chris had been working here for the past two years, and we had practically claimed our parking spots. If not through professional courtesy and unspoken understanding, then others knew not to park there because we were part of the influential senior crew. “Yep, a blue Ford Fusion, know anyone who drives that?” He takes a long puff of his e-cig and closes his eyes, rocking back and forth slightly. “I actually have no clue who has that car, did it look new?” <<if $carcheck is true>>\ “Yea, the inside looked like it was fresh off the lot.” “Then it’s definitely not any of ours, I would’ve heard someone bragging about it by now. It could belong to that guy I’ve seen walking with Lorette.” Before I can ask him more about this mysterious man, I spot him for myself. My manager walks towards us with the man in tow, reminding me of some overly-protective chaperone. <<else>>\ I shrug my shoulders just as our manager comes out, tapping on her tablet as she begins to bark out everyone’s job for the day. Beside her stands a man who doesn’t seem to understand personal space, gazing over her shoulder before peering at each of us. <</if>>\ “Everyone, this is our new General Manager, Mr. Pinsky. He wishes to supervise you all today to get a better understanding of how our days usually go.” Mr. Pinsky steps up, giving each one of us a card as he begins to explain his station, purpose, and the point of the cards. Suddenly I was thrust back to my freshman orientation class from two years ago. “I'll be reviewing each of you and writing down my notes on these cards. Later, I'll give them to your manager, and speak to her about them. The Alley has huge potential, and I plan to expand on it.” The perkiest among us immediately does what she is asked, while the rest of us stew in our spots about being supervised. The pressure of trying to act professionally was hard enough, and now we had no other choice but to grin and bear it. I gaze down at the card, it was asking the necessary things, nothing that wasn’t already on file. [[Male->MaleName]] [[Female->FemName]] [[Non-binary->NonName]] [[Transgender Female->FemName]] [[Transgender Male ->MaleName]]<<nobr>> <<set $gender = "male">> <<set $he = "he">> <<set $him = "him">> <<set $his = "his">> <<set $He = "He">> <<set $Him = "Him">> <<set $His = "His">> <<set $sir = "sir">> <<set $boy = "boy">> <<set $himself = "himself">> <<endnobr>> [[Damon.|NGD4_3][$name = "Damon"]] [[Arlo.|NGD4_3][$name = "Arlo"]] [[Kyrin.|NGD4_3][$name = "Kyrin"]] [[Jett.|NGD4_3][$name = "Jett"]] [[Leo.|NGD4_3][$name = "Leo"]] [[Can't believe I have to spell this out ... ->Insert Name]]<<nobr>> <<set $gender = "female">> <<set $he = "she">> <<set $him = "her">> <<set $his = "her">> <<set $He = "She">> <<set $Him = "Her">> <<set $His = "Her">> <<set $sir = "ma'am">> <<set $boy = "girl">> <<set $himself = "herself">> <<endnobr>> [[Zora.|NGD4_3][$name = "Zora"]] [[Marion.|NGD4_3][$name = "Marion"]] [[Nero.|NGD4_3][$name = "Nero"]] [[Delanie.|NGD4_3][$name = "Delanie"]] [[Sage.|NGD4_3][$name = "Sage"]] [[Can't believe I have to spell this out ... ->Insert Name]]<<nobr>> <<set $gender = "non-binary">> <<set $he = "they">> <<set $him = "them">> <<set $his = "theirs">> <<set $He = "They">> <<set $Him = "Them">> <<set $His = "Theirs">> <<set $sir = "mir">> <<set $boy = "child">> <<set $himself = "themself">> <<endnobr>> [[Hunter.|NGD4_3][$name = "Hunter"]] [[Robin.|NGD4_3][$name = "Robin"]] [[Indigo.|NGD4_3][$name = "Indigo"]] [[Quinn.|NGD4_3][$name = "Quinn"]] [[Cadence.|NGD4_3][$name = "Cadence"]] [[Can't believe I have to spell this out ... ->Insert Name]]I prepare to hand the card back when Chris nudges me, showing me the back of his card where more information rests. I flip my own over, shocked to see that the man wanted us to fill out appearance information. “Who else feels like they’re back in middle school taking some standardized test on a scantron?” Chris asks, clearing his throat when Mr. Pinsky looks his way. The first one was eye color. I look over at Chris who mimics a yawn, or maybe he was actually yawning. [[Bald.|NGD5][$hairlength = "bold"]] [[Short.|HairType][$hairlength = "short"]] [[Medium.|HairType][$hairlength = "medium"]] [[Long.|HairType][$hairlength = "long"]]Man, if life was like a video game, I would've definitely just saved cos I would not want to do that again. <<if $darkburns>>\ We each hand them back once he walks by to collect them. He freezes for a second, eyeing the burnt marks of my arms in horror. I clear my throat, and some had the audacity to wonder why I just keep to wearing long sleeve shirts. When he gets to Chris, he gives him a disapproving look, probably referring to the e-cig that was still in Chris’s free hand. With cards adequately filled, the two of them retreat, and we are left to get ready for the day. <</if>>\ <<if $darktruth>>\ We each hand them back once he walks by to collect them. He freezes for a second, eyeing the deep scar on my cheek in horror. I clear my throat, and he gets the picture. When he gets to Chris, he gives him a disapproving look, probably referring to the e-cig that was still in Chris’s free hand. With cards adequately filled, the two of them retreat, and we are left to get ready for the day. <</if>>\ <<if $darkcontrol>>\ We each hand them back once he walks by to collect them. When he gets to Chris, he gives him a disapproving look, probably referring to the e-cig that was still in Chris’s free hand. With cards adequately filled, the two of them retreat, and we are left to get ready for the day. <</if>>\ The day starts and rolls on like any other day. The best part about working at the outdoor bar was the attractive company and the large tips, earned by a few flirtatious smiles and well-placed compliments. Chris’s biggest tips came from the women, age and appearance mattered little. Chris adored working the outdoor bar because he was a master at gaining tips. Out here, our dress code was simpler and followed a tropical theme, allowing for Chris to wear clothes that complimented his physique. He didn’t shy away from muscle tank tops and loose swim trunks that gave away just enough to inspire the imagination. I watch with a small smirk as a woman takes a seductive sip of the drink Chris passes to her. She lets her eyes roam over his body before writing down her number and sliding it over to him along with a twenty-dollar tip. “Excuse me.” I turn my attention to the patron that has approached my side of the bar. [[A pretty young woman.]] [[A handsome young man.]] [[I was good with both, it just happened to be a handsome young man this time.]] [[It didn't matter, I wasn't interested, but it was a young woman.]][[Straight.|NGD5][$hairtype = "straight"]] [[Curly.|NGD5][$hairtype = "curly"]] [[Wavy.|NGD5][$hairtype = "wavy"]] [[Kinky.|NGD5][$hairtype = "kinky"]]<<nobr>> <<set $int = "women">> <<endnobr>> “How can I help you?” I ask, placing a small smile on my face. “Can I get a Strawberry-Lemon Mojito?” I nod and immediately begin to prep the overly ordered drink. I top it off with a beautiful flower ornament and slide it to her. “This flower is beautiful, does it always come with the drink?” she asks, gently touching the flower as if scared it would fall apart under the pressure of her touch. “No, I just didn’t think the drink was pretty enough to give to a girl of your beauty. Still isn’t, but I can only do so much.” I chuckle softly and send her another warm smile, one she returns immediately. “Is that like some undercover compliment?” “Was it? Sorry, you’re beautiful, was that one too forward?” She snickers and cocks her head to the side as if she was now seeing me differently. “Kinda, but sometimes it’s nice to just be told without having to feel like I owe the person.” I feign shock. “You mean people don’t line up to tell you this every day? The world is a tragic place.” Her smile expands, but she can say little else as her friends call her over. She sends me a broad smile and rummages through her bag for pen, paper, and a tip. With a wink, she slides the paper and tip my way before thanking me and walking off. [[Continue->ExplicitContent]]<<nobr>> <<set $int = "men">> <<endnobr>> “How can I help you?” I ask. “A Rum and Tonic for me,” he states, placing both his ID and the initial cost of the beverage on the table. I grab the money and check the ID lazily before making him the drink. I give him a quick look over, trying to figure out how I was going to earn my extra tip. He appears like any of the other college frat guys that show up, even his swim trunks had the symbol of his fraternity. Thankfully, he made typecasting him easy, as soon as I gave him his drink he took a selfie. I insert myself into the selfie, throwing up a peace sign. He doesn’t kick me out, but he does laugh, turning to face me with a raised brow. “Do you want to make it look like you’re really having fun? Include me,” I joke, and he smiles, backing up more. I lean forward seductively, and he matches my vibe almost immediately, taking the picture before showing me. “You’re really photogenic, or it could be that you’re naturally handsome,” I compliment. “Thanks, I’m trying to be a model.” I nod my head, you and everyone else that comes in here with glistening six-pack abs. “Nice, I can definitely see it.” He smiles again before handing me a ten and sending me a wink, leaving to join his friends. Sorry, you’re beautiful, was that one too forward?” She snickers and cocks her head to the side as if she was now seeing me differently. “Kinda, but sometimes it’s nice to just be told without having to feel like I owe the person.” I feign shock. “You mean people don’t line up to tell you this every day? She slides both my way before thanking me and walking off. I pocket the money as I drop the charade. [[Talking to those inside.|NGD6][$charisma +=5]] [[Handling cash and other transactions.|NGD6][$technology +=2]] [[Making sure the arcade machines were working.|NGD6][$technology +=5]] [[Supervising laser tag, which also meant playing when I wanted to.|NGD6][$combat +=2]] [[Delivering food in the restaurant.|NGD6][$charisma +=2]] [[Watching people fail at skating.|NGD6][$sympathy -=5]] [[Making sure no fights broke out at the bowling alley.|NGD6][$sympathy +=5, $charisma +=5]] [[Supervising everyone and everything.|NGD6][$perception +=5]] [[Sleeping.->NGD6]]“A well-formulated argument.
