[[Throw my blade at BB.]] [[Tell Sydero to throw her blade at BB.]] <</if>>\I go to Chris’s side, slowing down when he jumps at my approach, eyes wide in fright and anger. “I don’t know if you’re in there, Chris ... but I could really use my best friend right now. I know that you’re just ... confused and you don’t know what’s going on. But that’s what we’re here for. All of us out here, we’re trying to get you out, but we can’t do that without your help. We need to know how to subdue BB, how to turn you back.” He blinks his eyes, staring at me with an expressionless face. He gazes towards an impatient Sydero and a hopeful Bradley, looking back towards me. “$name?” he asks quietly, just loud enough for me to hear him. <<if $CRomance >= 3>>\ “Yea, it’s me, Chris,” I smile, my eyes widening when he raises his hand and rests it on my cheek. He slowly trails it down my face, cupping my cheek. “Okay, Beauty, you got through to your Beast, now can we go kill -” Sydero starts. “Gaston?!” Bradley shouts, earning a look from all of us, he quiets back down. But, as if on cue, BB roars loudly. <<else>>\ “Yea it’s me, Chris,” I smile, happy to finally get through to him. <</if>>\ I help Chris to his feet as he mumbles something under his breath. “I know how to calm it down. When I give you the signal then come out and subdue it.” He clenches his head, “and do it quickly, I can’t fight this much longer.” We agree and send Chris out the door, waiting for his signal. He slowly approaches BB who calms down tremendously upon seeing him. “I’m here,” I hear him say, detecting a bit of happiness in his tone. I seem to not be the only one who hears it, Syd gazing over at me and raising a brow. I had faith in him. He squats down, and BB sniffs him over, bringing him closer to them. If it weren’t such a weird picture, then it would almost be cute. As I stare at the two, I see Chris motion for us to come. “You take the left,” Syd says, slipping out the room first with me right behind her. She nods and we both dash forward, blades at the ready as we rush towards BB’s unaware figure. When BB finally notices us, it’s too late. Sydero rams into BB’s side and I grab Chris, yanking him backward across the concrete. It cries as Sydero slams her pistol down on its head constantly, its eyes on Chris’s figure as the light begins to fade out. “No!” he suddenly cries and lurches forward. “Keep him back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I tighten my arms around Chris as he struggles pathetically against me. “You’re hurting it!” Chris cries, turning to push me but I don’t budge. <<if $int is "both" or $int is "men">>\ [[Hug him tightly.]] <</if>>\ [[Slam him to the ground.]] [[Keep a tight grip on him.]]I go to Chris’s side, bending over and yanking Chris up to his feet. “Alright, this is how this is going to go. We’re going to let you go back to BB.” I suppose he still has an ounce of humanity inside of him, seeing the distrust in his eyes. “We’re doing what?” Sydero asks, bewildered brow raised as she looks to Bradley who is the same amount of confused. “You heard me. If Chris wants to go so bad, then I say we let him go. I’m tired of fighting for someone who doesn’t want to fight for himself.” The real Chris would take this as a challenge, or at least take offense to it. But this one just seems joyful, which I suppose is still a good thing. The real Chris would’ve easily known that I was lying. “Get out of my face,” I sigh, releasing him. He immediately rushes to the door, checking to see if Bradley or Sydero would follow. They don’t move, staring at him as he practically sprints to BB. I stand in the doorway watching them when Sydero comes by my side, watching them as well. BB was angled so that most of its back was pointed towards us. And luckily, its hulking figure blocked Chris’s view. <<if $athleticism >= 10>>\ “Plant your dagger somewhere and get Chris out of there, I’ll do the rest before the damn thing bleeds out,” Sydero directs, handing me my blade. I take it and gather up my speed, sprinting as quickly and quietly as I can towards BB’s great frame. I do exactly as she says once there, plunging my blade into BB’s neck and then grabbing Chris. I hear BB roar behind me but turn just in time to see Sydero ram into BB’s side. It cries as Sydero slams her pistol down on its head constantly, its eyes on Chris’s figure as the light begins to fade out. <<else>>\ “Let me take the lead, I’ll handle BB, just get Chris out of there,” Sydero directs. I nod, giving her more room. She takes off in a blindingly fast sprint, and once upon BB, plunges her dagger into its neck. I do exactly as she says once I make it to Chris, grabbing him and putting distance between us and the beast. It cries as Sydero slams her pistol down on its head constantly, its eyes on Chris’s figure as the light begins to fade out. <</if>>\ “You liar!” he screams, trying to fight me but putting up a weak fight. “Keep him back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I tighten my arms around Chris as he struggles pathetically against me. “You’re hurting it!” Chris cries, turning to push me but I don’t budge. <<if $int is "both" or $int is "men">>\ [[Hug him tightly.]] <</if>>\ [[Slam him to the ground.]] [[Keep a tight grip on him.]]<<if $cp>>\ <<if $blades >= 10>>\ I get an idea, deciding to throw my blade towards BB’s incoming figure. I aim for its face and toss the knife. It plants itself into BB’s side, not a bad throw but not what I was hoping for either. BB stops short, rearing up at the pain that is probably coursing through it. Sydero picks up her pace, ramming into BB’s side and bringing her pistol down onto its head multiple times. Its cries fade out but not before Chris’s join in. I jerk my head toward the doorway of the motel, seeing Chris stand there, and then sprinting towards us. “Keep him back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I shoot towards Chris, colliding with him and bringing him to the ground. <<else>>\ I get an idea, deciding to throw my blade towards BB’s incoming figure. I aim for its face and toss the knife, watching as it soars past him and lands harmlessly on the gravel road. “Nice idea, horrible execution,” Sydero shouts, throwing her blade instead. Hers lands in BB’s cheek, and it howls in pain. Sydero picks up her pace, ramming into BB and bringing her pistol down onto its head constant times. Its cries fade out but not before Chris’s join in. I jerk my head toward the doorway of the motel, seeing Chris stand there, and then sprinting towards us. “Keep him back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I shoot towards Chris, colliding with him and bringing him to the ground. <</if>>\ “Get off me!” Chris yells, attempting to push me off of him, but failing. His cries don’t even remind me of someone who’s lost someone in front of him, they sound different, as if something had taken him over and was using his voice to voice its own thoughts. [[Calm him down.]] [[Knock him out.->BBKO2]] <<else>>\ <<if $blades >= 10>>\ I get an idea, deciding to throw my blade towards BB’s incoming figure. I aim for its face and toss the knife. It plants itself into BB’s side, not a bad throw but not what I was hoping for either. BB stops short, rearing up at the pain that is probably coursing through it. Sydero picks up her pace, ramming into BB and bringing her pistol down onto its head multiple times. Its cries fade out but not before Winfrey’s join in. I jerk my head toward the doorway of the motel, seeing Winfrey stand there, and then sprinting towards us. “Keep her back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I shoot towards Winfrey, colliding with her and bringing her to the ground. <<else>>\ I get an idea, deciding to throw my blade towards BB’s incoming figure. I aim for its face and toss the knife, watching as it soars past him and lands harmlessly on the gravel road. “Nice idea, horrible execution,” Sydero shouts, throwing her blade instead. Hers lands in BB’s cheek, and it howls in pain. Sydero picks up her pace, ramming into BB and bringing her pistol down onto its head constant times. Its cries fade out but not before Winfrey’s join in. I jerk my head toward the doorway of the motel, seeing Winfrey standing there, and then sprinting towards us. “Keep her back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I shoot towards Winfrey, colliding with her and bringing her to the ground. <</if>>\ <<if $hairlength is "bald">>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something, and I suppose she forgets that I don’t have any hair to grab. <<elseif $hairlength is "short">>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something, lucky for me there’s not much hair to grab. <<elseif $hairlength is "medium">>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something. Her fingers trails across my hair but before can grab it, I yank my head back, out of reach. <<else>>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something, clutching onto my hair. She yanks my head down and I yelp as I involuntarily follow her hand, fighting with her to release my hair. “The hell, Roe? Stop playing games,” Syd growls. “Shut up, Syd! What kind of game is this?” I yell back, finally unlatching her hands from my hair. <</if>>\ [[Calm her down.]] [[Knock her out.->BBKO2]] <</if>>\<<if $cp>>\ “Syd!” I bark, getting an idea, “throw your knife at BB.” She nods and does as I ask, throwing her blade which lands in BB’s cheek. It howls in pain, desperately clawing at the blade to remove it. Sydero picks up her pace, ramming into BB and bringing her pistol down onto its head multiple times. Its cries fade out but not before Chris’s join in. I jerk my head toward the doorway of the motel, seeing Chris stand there, and then sprinting towards us. “Keep him back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I shoot towards Chris, colliding with him and bringing him to the ground. “Get off me!” Chris yells, attempting to push me off of him, but failing. His cries don’t even remind me of someone who’s lost someone in front of him, they sound different, as if something had taken him over and was using his voice to voice its own thoughts. [[Calm him down.]] [[Knock him out.->BBKO2]] <<else>>\ “Syd!” I bark, getting an idea, “throw your knife at BB.” She nods and does as I ask, throwing her blade which lands in BB’s cheek. It howls in pain, desperately clawing at the blade to remove it. Sydero picks up her pace, ramming into BB and bringing her pistol down onto its head multiple times. Its cries fade out but not before Winfrey’s join in. I jerk my head toward the doorway of the motel, seeing Winfrey stand there, and then sprinting towards us. “Keep her back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I shoot towards Winfrey, colliding with her and bringing her to the ground. <<if $hairlength is "bald">>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something, and I suppose she forgets that I don’t have any hair to grab. <<elseif $hairlength is "short">>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something, lucky for me there’s not much hair to grab. <<elseif $hairlength is "medium">>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something. Her fingers trails across my hair but before can grab it, I yank my head back, out of reach. <<else>>\ “Get off me!” Winfrey yells, attempting to push me off of her. She reaches up in an attempt to grab something, clutching onto my hair. She yanks my head down and I yelp as I involuntarily follow her hand, fighting with her to release my hair. “The hell, Roe? Stop playing games,” Syd growls. “Shut up, Syd! What kind of game is this?” I yell back, finally unlatching her hands from my hair. <</if>>\ [[Calm her down.]] [[Knock her out.->BBKO2]] <</if>>\<<nobr>> <<set $CRomance +=1>> <<endnobr>> I wrap my arms around him and hug him tightly, burrowing my face in the crook of his neck as he continues to cry out. “I’m sorry,” I tell him, hearing BB’s whimpering nearby, but I had a feeling that BB wasn’t concerned with its own welfare, but another’s. I feel arms wrap around me and at first, I believe Chris was going to try something else. I only calm down when he turns in his spot, pressing his face into my chest as BB’s moans fade out. “Roe, hold Chris down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Chris’s face, eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Chris, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “It’s for Chris,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Chris next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given him. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “He has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift his head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into his mouth, covering his mouth with my hand, forcing him to swallow. Chris’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly he stops, he is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if he’s still alive, when he suddenly rolls over onto his stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Chris?” I inquire. He breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what the hell happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist -=2>> <<endnobr>> I resituate myself and lean all of my weight onto Chris, somehow managing to slam him to the ground and then sit on him. His growls go from human to animalistic, clawing at the ground as he reaches his hand out towards BB. BB’s eyes slowly close, and its moans slowly fade out. “Roe, hold Chris down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Chris’s face, eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Chris, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “It’s for Chris,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Chris next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given him. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “He has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift his head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into his mouth, covering his mouth with my hand, forcing him to swallow. Chris’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly he stops, he is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if he’s still alive, when he suddenly rolls over onto his stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Chris?” I inquire. He breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what the hell happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist +=2>> <<endnobr>> I tighten my grip as much as I can, keeping him in place as Sydero does whatever she needs to do. In a handful of seconds, she removes her hand and nods at me, bringing her pistol down over BB’s head for the final time. “Roe, hold Chris down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Chris’s face, eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Chris, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “It’s for Chris,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Chris next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given him. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “He has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift his head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into his mouth, covering his mouth with my hand, forcing him to swallow. Chris’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly he stops, he is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if he’s still alive, when he suddenly rolls over onto his stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Chris?” I inquire. He breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what the hell happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<if $cp>>\ I round the corner of my car, sitting beside Chris as he gulps down the water in his grasp. The park rests before us, not yet lively but filled with morning joggers and dog walkers. The dogs yip at their owners, looking a lot freer than they did yesterday. The area is in peace, and the only threat to that peace is our two companion's bickering off to the side, still leaning on shovels that were borrowed from some random person’s shed. “How are you feeling?” I ask, looking over at Chris. He glances down at the water in his hands. “I don’t remember anything. The last thing I recall is us coming here to talk to some of the folks about the beast. After that, everything gets hazy with random images flashing but not enough to piece them together. But it’s not what I remember, it’s what I feel.” “Which is?” “I feel horrible. I don’t remember what happened, but I can still feel the pain that the beast felt every time you guys struck it. I felt like I was watching my own parent die in front of me. I know it had to do with whatever it did to me, but, there’s still a piece of me that’s overly sad about it being dead. It’s fading, but it’s there. But I keep wondering, why me? It could’ve scratched anyone, why did it choose to scratch me?” [[“It’s over now, let’s try to move on.”]] [[“It saw a dummy and took advantage.”]] [[“Do you feel anything lingering?”]] <<else>>\ I nod to the nurse as I enter Winfrey’s room, her parents off to the side speaking to a police officer. I would have to make this quick, especially since Winfrey miraculously was returned with no signs of foul play. “How are you holding up?” I question. “Good, I think. I remember some of the stuff that happened, but there are some holes too.” “Probably due to when you were going feral and weren’t yourself.” “Yea, I can’t believe I was playing house with the thing that killed my dog. What was it you guys called it?” “A cryptid,” I glance over at her parents, “what did you tell them?” “That I went out trying to kill whatever killed Jessie, and ended up being jumped by someone, never saw their faces though. I told them that Bradley and Sydero found me since you told me that you weren’t 'there'.” She gives me a questioning look, but I ignore it. The less she knew, the better. “You know, the weirdest thing isn’t that I don’t remember much, only what I remember feeling.” “Which is?” “I can still feel the pain that the beast felt every time you guys struck it. I felt like I was watching my own parent die in front of me. I know it had to do with whatever it did to me, but, there’s still a piece of me that’s really sad about it being dead. It’s fading, but it’s there. I keep wondering, why me? It could’ve scratched anyone, why did it choose to scratch me?” [[“Doesn’t matter. It’s over now, try and move on.”]] [[“It saw an opportunity and took it.”]] [[“Do you feel anything else?”]] <</if>>\I go to Winfrey’s side, slowing down when she jumps at my approach, eyes wide in fright and anger. “Winfrey, I know you don’t know me that well ... but we could really use your help right now. I know that you’re just confused, and you don’t know what’s going on. But that’s what we’re here for. We need to know how to subdue BB, how to turn you back.” She blinks her eyes, staring at me with an expressionless face. Her gazes towards an impatient Sydero and a hopeful Bradley, looking back towards me. “Oh, okay,” she asks quietly, just loud enough for me to hear her, “I know how to calm it down. When I give you the signal then come out and subdue it.” She clenches her head, “and do it quickly, I can’t fight this much longer.” We agree and send Winfrey out the door, waiting for her signal. She slowly approaches BB who calms down tremendously upon seeing her. “I’m here,” I hear her say, detecting a bit of happiness in her tone. I seem to not be the only one who hears it, Syd gazing over at me and raising a brow. I had faith in her. She squats down, and BB sniffs her over, bringing her figure closer to it. If it weren’t such a weird picture, then it would almost be cute. As I stare at the two, I see Winfrey motion for us to come. “You take the left,” Syd says, slipping out the room first with me right behind her. She nods and we both dash forward, blades at the ready as we rush towards BB’s unaware figure. When BB finally notices us, it’s too late. Sydero rams into BB’s side and I grab Winfrey, yanking her backward across the concrete. It cries as Sydero slams her pistol down on its head constantly, its eyes on Winfrey’s figure as the light begins to fade out. “No!” she suddenly cries and lurches forward. “Keep her back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I tighten my arms around Winfrey as she struggles pathetically against me. “You’re hurting it!” Winfrey cries, turning to push me but I don’t budge. [[Slam her to the ground.]] [[Hug Winfrey.]]I go to Winfrey’s side, bending over and yanking her to her feet. “Hey, easy there, $name,” Bradley says, taking a step towards me. I ignore him, “alright, this is how this is going to go. We’re going to let you go back to BB.” I suppose she still has an ounce of humanity inside of her, seeing her eyes light up in fear and revulsion. “Whoa, we’re doing what?” Sydero asks, bewildered and brow raised as she looks to Bradley who is the same amount of confused. “You heard me. If she wants to go so bad, then I say we let her go. I’m tired of fighting for someone who doesn’t want to fight for herself.” “Get out of my face,” I sigh, releasing her. She stays where she is, trying to prove me wrong but her instincts overwhelm her. She rushes to the door, checking to see if Bradley or Sydero would follow. They don’t move, staring at her as she practically sprints to BB. I stand in the doorway watching them when Sydero comes by my side, watching them as well. BB was angled so that most of its back was pointed towards us. And luckily, its hulking figure blocked Winfrey’s view. <<if $athleticism >= 10>>\ “Plant your dagger somewhere and get the girl out of there, I’ll do the rest before the damn thing bleeds out,” Sydero directs, handing me my blade. I take it and gather up my speed, sprinting as quickly and quietly as I can towards BB’s great frame. I do exactly as she says once there, plunging my blade into BB’s neck and then grabbing Winfrey. I hear BB roar behind me but turn just in time to see Sydero ram into BB’s side. It cries as Sydero slams her pistol down on its head constantly, its eyes on Winfrey’s figure as the light begins to fade out. <<else>>\ “Let me take the lead, I’ll handle BB, just get the girl out of there,” Sydero directs. I nod, giving her more room. She takes off in a blindingly fast sprint, and once upon BB, plunges her dagger into its neck. I do exactly as she says once I make it to Winfrey, grabbing her and putting distance between us and the beast. It cries as Sydero slams her pistol down on its head constantly, its eyes on Winfrey’s figure as the light begins to fade out. “You liar!” she screams, trying to fight me but putting up a weak fight. “Keep her back,” Sydero orders, giving BB one last knock upside the head before murmuring some words. I tighten my arms around Winfrey as she struggles pathetically against me. “You’re hurting it!” Winfrey cries, turning to push me but I don’t budge. <</if>>\ [[Slam her to the ground.]] [[Hug Winfrey.]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist -=2>> <<endnobr>> I resituate myself and lean all of my weight onto Winfrey, somehow managing to slam her to the ground and then sit on her. Her growls go from human to animalistic, clawing at the ground as she reaches her hand out towards BB. BB’s eyes slowly close and its moans, slowly fade out. “Roe, hold her down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Winfrey’s figure underneath me, struggling and eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Winfrey, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “Do it to save a life,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Winfrey next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given her. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “She has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift her head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into her mouth, covering her mouth with my hand, forcing her to swallow. Winfrey’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly she stops, she is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if she’s still alive, when she suddenly rolls over onto her stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Winfrey?” I inquire. She breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<nobr>> <<set $pacifist +=2>> <<endnobr>> I tighten my grip as much as I can, keeping her from looking at what Sydero had to do to subdue BB. “I’m sorry, I know,” I say, hoping my voice would calm her back down, “just don’t look.” She hugs me tightly. “Roe, hold her down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Winfrey’s figure underneath me, struggling and eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Winfrey, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “Do it to save a life,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Winfrey next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given her. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “She has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift her head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into her mouth, covering her mouth with my hand, forcing her to swallow. Winfrey’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly she stops, she is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if she’s still alive, when she suddenly rolls over onto her stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Winfrey?” I inquire. She breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<nobr>> <<set $sympathy +5>> <<endnobr>> “Chill out, Chris,” I yell, grabbing his shoulders and forcing them to the ground as hard as possible, “look at me. Come on, it’s me, Chris. This isn’t you, we’re just trying to help you.” He calms down slightly, still thrashing every now and then, but he mostly calms down. I can feel his heart, thumping dramatically against his chest. “Roe, hold Chris down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Chris’s face, eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Chris, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “It’s for Chris,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Chris next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given him. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “He has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift his head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into his mouth, covering his mouth with my hand, forcing him to swallow. Chris’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly he stops, he is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if he’s still alive, when he suddenly rolls over onto his stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Chris?” I inquire. He breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what the hell happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<if $cp>>\ <<nobr>> <<set $sympathy -=5>> <<set $knockoutchris = true>> <<endnobr>> I knock him out with one well-placed punch. He was definitely going to give me hell when he wakes up later. As a precaution, I remain on top of Chris, fearing that he’ll wake up before Sydero can finish whatever the spell/ritual called for. “Roe, hold Chris down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Chris’s face, eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Chris, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “It’s for Chris,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Chris next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given him. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. He breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what the hell happened?” <<else>>\ <<nobr>> <<set $sympathy -=5>> <<set $knockoutgirl = true>> <<endnobr>> I knock her out with one well-placed punch. As a precaution, I remain on top of her, fearing that she’ll wake up before Sydero can finish whatever the spell/ritual called for. “Roe, hold her down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Winfrey, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “Do it to save a life,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Winfrey next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given her. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “She has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift her head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into her mouth, covering her mouth with my hand, forcing her to swallow. Winfrey’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly she stops, she is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if she’s still alive, when she suddenly rolls over onto her stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Winfrey?” I inquire. She breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what happened?” <</if>>\ [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<nobr>> <<set $sympathy +5>> <<endnobr>> “Chill out, Winfrey,” I yell, grabbing her shoulders and forcing them to the ground as hard as possible, “we’re just trying to help you.” She calms down slightly, still thrashing every now and then, but she mostly calms down. I can feel her heart, thumping dramatically against her chest. “Roe, hold her down, I’ll be right back.” Sydero dashes inside, sending Bradley out to me with a bowl in his hands. He freezes when he sees Winfrey’s figure underneath me, struggling and eyes red from crying so much. His eyes then go to BB’s body, its breathing highly labored as it takes its last breaths. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Winfrey, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “Do it to save a life,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Winfrey next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given her. He sets the bowl down and Sydero comes back out, in her hands is the illuminating blue liquid that I had seen in her bag before. She pours half of the small bottle into the bowl and then mixes it with a spoon. “She has to drink this.” She hands the bowl to me, “quick, before BB is dead.” Bradley helps lift her head up, and I force the contents in the bowl into her mouth, covering her mouth with my hand, forcing her to swallow. Winfrey’s body begins to convulse quickly when suddenly she stops, she is entirely still. I reach forward, mostly to see if she’s still alive, when she suddenly rolls over onto her stomach, vomiting onto the pavement. “You back with us, Winfrey?” I inquire. She breathes harshly, spitting before looking up at me, “what happened?” [[Later that Day->BB5]]<<nobr>> <<set $heartsonfire = true>> <<endnobr>> Destroy the hearts, and that might put a damper on whatever BB was hoping for. I didn’t have a lighter, but there was a good chance that Sydero did. But for me to be able to ask her, I needed some breathing room. I wait for him to approach, blocking his strikes and when I get an opening, I push him to the ground roughly. “Syd, lighter?” I shout, barely dodging Chris’s charging figure. I jump to the side, slipping on a puddle of slick blood. When I turn, Chris is right there. I get ready to dart, but he bears his weight down on me, pinning me to the ground and growling. [[Knee him in the groin.]] [[Head butt him.]] <<if $int is "both" or $int is "men">>\ [[Kiss him?]] <</if>>\Chris couldn’t do anything if he couldn’t move. I lead him around and around, dodging his strikes and the things that he throws at me. I’m less successful at avoiding the rocks that he picks up, especially when a sharp one hits the side of my face. I stumble backward, slipping on a puddle of slick blood. When I turn, Chris is right there. I get ready to dart, but he bears his weight down on me, pinning me to the ground and growling. [[Knee him in the groin.]] [[Head butt him.]] <<if $int is "both" or $int is "men">>\ [[Kiss him?]] <</if>>\He was more beast than human right now, and like most predators, they had a need to chase their prey. It wasn’t a thought that I wanted to think too hard on, so I focus more on prompting him to pursue me. I throw some rocks I find his way, always running off and seeing if he follows. He does, but avoiding Sydero and the pit of hearts is harder than I thought. The clearing was only so big, and he gets too close for comfort many times. I feel his presence beside me, and he grabs my shirt. I dance out of his grasp but stumble backward, slipping on a puddle of slick blood. When I turn, Chris is right there. I get ready to dart, but he bears his weight down on me, pinning me to the ground and growling. [[Knee him in the groin.]] [[Head butt him.]] <<if $int is "both" or $int is "men">>\ [[Kiss him?]] <</if>>\<<if $heartsonfire>>\ I struggle under him, probably making it seem as if I was trying to get free when I was really just making room to better maneuver my knee. He might be acting like a beast, but his anatomy was still human. “Roe!” I hear Syd shout and I look up, barely able to catch the lighter she throws my way. He might be acting like a beast, but his anatomy was still human. The opponent always getting blindsided by the kiss and freezing. But they were human, and no cryptid virus was actively swimming through their bloodstreams. Regardless, I go through with the plan, leaning up and placing my lips on top of Chris’s. It’s a simple kiss, one that makes me feel like some shy elementary school kid. But it also does what I intend for it to do. Chris freezes, his eyes staring into mine as I pull back. He blinks and cocks his head slightly. <<if $heartsonfire>>\ “$name?” Before I can react, his eyes roll up to the back of his head, and I hear a loud thump. He collapses onto me, with Syd standing behind him, throwing the large branch to the ground. I sit on Chris’s back, making sure to be ready in case he does come back from that knockout. <</if>>\ [[Continue->BB4_3]]Sydero sends a text to Bradley, telling him to meet us here with the things she needs. I see her bite the inside of her cheek, looking down at the beast whose breathing is labored. I could see the blood dripping down onto the grass, creating a puddle on the soft cedar colored dirt. Her blade was still nestled in the side of its neck, pulling it out would mean quickening its death. BB picks up its head and roars softly for Chris, even attempting to crawl towards him. “No,” Chris moans, trying to move and get to BB, “don’t do this,” he begs. Neither Sydero nor I say anything, ignoring the whimpering that both of them make, blocking it out until Bradley shows up. He comes rushing into the clearing, stopping short at the stick barricade. Dangling from his shoulder is Sydero’s book bag and gripped tightly in his hand is his phone. “Roe, hold Chris down,” Sydero commands, taking her bag from Bradley and rummaging through it. She hands Bradley a bowl, and he heads over towards BB. I’m aware of what those blue eyes are focused on. Not on Chris, but me. Its eyes stare straight at me, perhaps wanting me to look at where my choices have led. “It’s for Chris,” I hear Bradley murmur, grabbing his own knife and cutting into BB’s side, blood pours out, and he catches some of it in the bowl, approaching me. He shivers slightly but steels himself, “I need some blood from Chris next.” I nod, watching as he gets the blood from the infected wound that BB had given him. Isn’t that the whole point of hiding? Not being found?” She hits the table, her anger not directed at me or my words, but because of her own fear. “But we have heard nothing. I don’t like this. It’s a dangerous job, but someone has to do it.” [[“The most dangerous thing you face is fingers cramping up.”]] [[“Agreed, Bradley’s one of the best hunters I know.”]] [[Say nothing.->BBSayNothing2]]With my beverage in hand, I head to the second line and join Chris who is standing in the back. I imagine you’re pretty hungry.” Chris shivers, “I think I’m going to order every pastry they have now.” I chuckle, taking a long sip of my drink as we wait for the line to move forward. “It’s still hard to believe, I was going to turn into some weird ass cryptid with parenting issues. How did you guys figure out what to do to change me back anyway?” “Bradley came up with it really, telling Sydero to do some empathy spell so that she could learn what was motivating BB and what BB didn’t want us to do.” “And somehow BB was intelligent enough to give her the answer?” I didn’t have the answer he was looking for, especially since I didn’t really understand it myself. “I guess so. I just know it worked. But, she did use that weird glowing blue stuff to change you. Are you sure you don’t feel weird?” “Besides being hungry? Nope, I feel like I did yesterday morning.” I nod, turning when I hear Sydero call our names. She points to the car, Bradley, and Hillary leaving behind her. Chris orders and grabs his food before we leave, walking towards the car. Otherwise, we would be getting swamped with questions.” <<if $car is "Ford F-150">>\ "Good thing you have a Ford, huh? That bed finally coming in handy." I follow behind her, calling out to Bradley. <</if>>\ [[Continue->BB6_1]]“So, where to next?” I question, moving to the left when Bradley leans forward, propping himself up on the armrest console. “I got wind of another job,” he sings, unphased by the looks that we all give him. No one disagrees, mostly since none of us had a better idea, and I certainly didn’t want to head back to the safehouse. “Alright, send me the coordinates,” I put my car in drive and peel out into the street, leaving the town behind us. Leaving Bladenboro behind. <<if $cp>>\ “Oh, one more thing,” Bradley begins, “I asked Hillary and she agreed with me, grapes would totally win in a fruit fight.” <</if>>\ [[Next Time on Superstition->EP7NT]]<<nobr>> <<set $bradley -=5>> <<endnobr>> I snort, sending bubbles over the surface of my drink. Both teens look up, finally noticing me, “seriously, Bradley? The most dangerous thing you face is your fingers cramping up from typing.” Hillary giggles while Bradley turns three shades of the brightest red I’ve ever seen. “Hacking is a lot of work too,” he squeaks out, clearing his throat and changing the conversation. “So, I guess you’ll be leaving soon?” Hillary questions, playing with her fingers. “Yea, I just want you to know that it was amazing to meet you. Like, you’re always the real MVP when we game and, I mean it’s an honor to finally meet the gamer behind the tag.” Bradley fights his blush, rubbing his arm as he compliments Hillary. “Yea, well you’re the real MVP in real life, taking on things that no one even knows exist.” <<if $cp>>\ “Heading out,” Sydero sings, looking towards us since Chris was already at her side. <<else>>\ “Heading out,” Sydero sings, looking towards us before she walks out of the café. <</if>>\ <<if $BradHill>>\ “I guess this is goodbye,” Bradley states, standing and offering his hand to Hillary. She leans in and places a cute chaste kiss to his cheek, both of them blushing furiously. “Don’t you dare die out there. I need MasterRadBrad69 on my future squad missions.” Bradley nods his head, promising her as he leads us away from her table. “Aw, you guys are adorable, but I must ask. MasterRadBrad69?” I smirk. Bradley is still waving goodbye to Hillary when he turns to me, “what do you want me to say? I was twelve, on my own, and they don’t let you change your gamertag. You speak to no one about this.” <<if $serious >= 50>>\ “Of course,” I chuckle, both of us walking out of the café and towards the car. <<else>>\ “Whatever you say, MasterRadBrad69,” I smirk, earning a punch from Bradley as he grumbles and leaves the café. I right behind him. <</if>>\ <<else>>\ “I guess this is goodbye,” Bradley states, standing and offering his hand to Hillary. She takes and shakes it, “I guess it is. It was nice meeting you, MasterRadBrad69. See you on our next deployment?” “Of course,” Bradley waves her away as we head towards the door. “Seriously? MasterRadBrad69?” I smirk. Bradley sighs sadly as he turns away from Hillary and to me, “what do you want me to say? I was twelve, on my own, and they don’t let you change your gamertag. You speak to no one about this.” <<if $serious >= 50>>\ “Of course,” I chuckle, both of us walking out of the café and towards the car. <<else>>\ “Whatever you say, MasterRadBrad69,” I smirk, earning a punch from Bradley as he grumbles and leaves the café. I right behind him. <</if>>\ <</if>>\ [[Continue->BB6_1]] <<nobr>> <<set $bradley +=5>> <<endnobr>> “I couldn’t agree more, and this kid,” I say, pointing at Bradley, “is one of the best hunters I know.” I leave out the part that he’s the only one I know, seeing that Sydero was a specialist, but she didn’t need to know that. Bradley gives me a thankful smile and beams at Hillary who gazes at him in admiration. “So, I guess you’ll be leaving soon?” Hillary questions, playing with her fingers. “Yea, I just want you to know that it was amazing to meet you. Like, you’re always the real MVP when we game and, I mean it’s an honor to finally meet the gamer behind the tag.” Bradley fights his blush, rubbing his arm as he compliments Hillary. “Yea, well you’re the real MVP in real life, taking on things that no one even knows exist.” <<if $cp>>\ “Heading out,” Sydero sings, looking towards us since Chris was already at her side. <<else>>\ “Heading out,” Sydero sings, looking towards us before she walks out of the café. <</if>>\ <<if $BradHill>>\ “I guess this is goodbye,” Bradley states, standing and offering his hand to Hillary. I need MasterRadBrad69 on my future squad missions.” Bradley nods his head, promising her as he leads us away from her table. “Aw, you guys are adorable, but I must ask. MasterRadBrad69?” I smirk. You speak to no one about this.” <<if $serious >= 50>>\ “Of course,” I chuckle, both of us walking out of the café and towards the car. <<else>>\ “Whatever you say, MasterRadBrad69,” I smirk, earning a punch from Bradley as he grumbles and leaves the café. I right behind him. <</if>>\ <</if>>\ [[Continue->BB6_1]] I don’t say anything, just placing my drink on the table as Bradley tries to seem humble but boost himself up at the same time. “So, I guess you’ll be leaving soon?” Hillary questions, playing with her fingers. “Yea, I just want you to know that it was amazing to meet you. You speak to no one about this.” <<if $serious >= 50>>\ “Of course,” I chuckle, both of us walking out of the café and towards the car. <<else>>\ “Whatever you say, MasterRadBrad69,” I smirk, earning a punch from Bradley as he grumbles and leaves the café. I right behind him. <</if>>\ <</if>>\ [[Continue->BB6_1]] <<nobr>> <<set $ep8unlock = true>> <<endnobr>> <<link [img[images/nexttime.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/divider.png]] >><</link>> “Please tell me this is my bed,” I hear Sydero say, jerking in my spot to see her resting nearby, or who I think is her. Voice-wise, it’s her, no doubt. But appearance is another thing entirely. <<link [img[images/divider.png]] >><</link>> “You were right, we’re in my book. The one I was reading before all of this happened.” “I’m sure that should make me feel better, but it doesn’t,” Sydero sighs, “we know where we are but not why, how, or anything –” <<link [img[images/divider.png]] >><</link>> She shakes her head, “no. What I feel is not that. This spirit is not the same.” I take a deep breath in and out, for the first time ever, I wish for the Entity to speak. But of course, the one time I need it, they don’t. The Entity … wasn’t the Entity? <<link [img[images/divider.png]] >><</link>> “$name,” I hear the Entity speak, his voice on the edge of my consciousness, sounding uncharacteristically calm, “she has the power to kill you. Let me help.” The tendril holds me in place as she glares at me in the face, “you will pay.” The tendril squeezes. Though it is merely a tendril, I can feel it prickling my skin. “$name!” the Entity shouts, “just let me take control. Don’t let your pride kill you.” I’m slipping, I can feel that much, and staring into her eyes, I know that no sympathy rests within them. <<if $ep8unlock>>\ [[Episode Eight: For the Crown]] <</if>>\ [[Return to Navigation->Season One]] <<nobr>> <<unset $withchris, $withgirl, $Syderobar, $boyanddog, $catlady, $claw, $drink, $food, $noalcohol, $BradHill, $doglike, $catlike, $knockoutchris, $motel, $afterhim, $split, $heartsonfire, $answer1>> <<audio "prologue" unloop fadeout>> <<endnobr>> <<link [img[images/epeight.png]] >><</link>> <<link [img[images/actone.png]] >><</link>> The feeling of having all of your senses nulled in a mysterious place is possibly the weirdest experience to have. I could hear just fine, but I wasn’t familiar with the sounds coming from deeper within. Fire crackling, a deep and melodic hum, and something else, something that I couldn’t put my finger on. I could also feel, but of course when you’re in a pitch-black hallway that doesn’t allow for one’s eyes to refocus, then it was hard to figure out what you were touching. <<if $cp>>\ This building was unnecessarily cold. And as I follow behind Sydero, listening to the sounds of my footsteps echoing off the tile floor, that thought is what stays at the forefront of my mind. My own footsteps were constantly reminding me that I was making too much noise, but didn’t give me a way to cease it. I knew there was some secret to it, since I couldn't hear Sydero, but knew that she resides ahead of me due to me constantly bumping into her when she stopped. Even Chris was silent, the loudest thing about him was his uncontrolled breathing. The deeper we went, the more fearful he became. <<else>>\ This building was unnecessarily cold. And as I follow behind Sydero, listening to the sounds of my footsteps echoing off the tile floor, that thought is what stays at the forefront of my mind. My own footsteps were constantly reminding me that I was making too much noise, but didn’t give me a way to cease it. I knew there was some secret to it, since I couldn't hear Sydero, but knew that she resides ahead of me due to me constantly bumping into her when she stopped. <</if>>\ “I think we’re here,” Sydero says, stopping at what I can only presume is a door, “remember, witches die just like any mortal.” I nod, reaching for my gun to make sure it was still there, could never be too careful. Sydero pushes the door open and we dash inside, but there’s no one there. <<if $cp>>\ “I think you got the wrong room, Syd,” Chris points out, lowering the gun in his hands. “Shut up,” Syd growls, shoving him out of the way and walking towards a reversed pentagram. She crouches and begins going through a large mixing bowl that sits at one of the points. The room was a complete mess, even if they weren’t here now, they were a few minutes ago. This room holds at least three windows, but each had shabby wood panels blocking the outside world. The floor held a mix of dirt, trash, and what I can only assume was animal feces. Large holes rest on the floor, while smaller ones can be seen in the ceiling. The ones in the ceiling had small horrible patchwork done to them, the floor ones were left untreated. “What are you doing?” I ask Syd who picks up several thick strands of what looks like cheese. She sniffs it and frowns. “Ginger root. Ginger root. Ginger root,” she repeats again and again, tapping her foot. “What about it?” Chris questions. “I forget what it’s used for, it’s the only thing in that bowl I don’t know. Shit! What is it used for,” she shouts in frustration. “Passion, wealth, success, long life, it has many uses young one,” a voice says behind us. We each twist around to see a group of six men and women enter the room. The one in front, and I suppose the speaker, is an old crone with a cigarette resting in her loose grasp. “But for us, we’re using it for means of power.” She lifts a finger and everyone behind her surges forward to attack. Two head for me, one for Chris, and the other two have their eyes set on Syd, but she seems more interested in the old woman. <<else>>\ Sydero groans, heading towards a reversed pentagram. She crouches and begins going through a large mixing bowl that sits at one of the points. The room was a complete mess, even if they weren’t here now, they were a few minutes ago. This room holds at least three windows, but each had shabby wood panels blocking the outside world. The floor held a mix of dirt, trash, and what I can only assume was animal feces. Large holes rest on the floor, while smaller ones can be seen in the ceiling. The ones in the ceiling had small horrible patchwork done to them, the floor ones were left untreated. “What are you doing?” I ask Syd who picks up several thick strands of what looks like cheese. She sniffs it and frowns. “Ginger root. Ginger root. Ginger root,” she repeats again and again, tapping her foot. “What about it?” “I forget what it’s used for, it’s the only thing in that bowl I don’t know. Shit! What is it used for,” she shouts in frustration. “Passion, wealth, success, long life, it has many uses young one,” a voice says behind us. We each twist around to see a group of six men and women enter the room. The one in front, and I suppose the speaker, is an old crone with a cigarette resting in her loose grasp. “But for us, we’re using it for means of power.” She lifts a finger and everyone behind her surges forward to attack. Two head for me and the other three have their eyes set on Syd, but she seems more interested in the old woman. <</if>>\ “Don’t go near the pentagram!” Syd screams before engaging her assaulters. The two heading towards me was a man and a woman. The woman was remarkably smaller than the man but would get to me first. [[Take out the woman’s leg.]] [[Use the environment to my advantage.]] [[Trick the lady.]]I raise my gun and aim for the woman’s leg, hoping to slow her down. She was remarkably deft on her feet, managing to avoid each of the three shots aimed at her. Her power could have to do with agility, no normal human could move like that. I discover her power, but I also do no damage, and she is upon me. I begin to throw a punch when she swiftly dodges it and strikes me in my stomach, kicking my feet out from under me. //Cute//, I think to myself, rolling out of the way before the guy could deliver a punch. She was fast, but lucky for me I scrimmage with a woman whose style was similar to hers, only the woman I scrimmage with was quicker and a lot more ruthless and a lot less sloppy. Syd taught me how to read others, and I personally learned how to combat her style of fighting. She screams in agony as she goes down, lunging out and bringing her leg closer to her. Hopefully, she didn’t have some insta-heal potion, because I had to deal with her friend now. <<if $cp>>\ “Hey, could use some help over here!” Chris shouts, and I look just in time to see his body get flung across the room. <</if>>\ The man is upon me before I can plan my next moves, he grabs my wrist and wrestles the gun out of my hands, it goes skidding across the floor, almost falling into one of the holes. Great. <<if $cp>>\ “Busy!” I shout back. <</if>>\ I try to shove the man off of me, but his grip is unyielding, in one smooth move, he lifts me up and tosses me over his shoulder. I hear his footsteps, carrying them towards me. I gaze around, searching for anything to give me an advantage. [[Lunge towards him.]] [[Use the ... animal droppings.]] [[Put more space between us.]]Nothing rests around me, and so my possibilities grow tremendously small. Only being able to think of one thing, I decide to lunge for the man coming towards me, taking out his legs. He joins me on the ground, both of us now on equal ground. <<if $style is "Aikido">>\ In all honesty, this wasn’t equal at all. My style wasn’t suitable for both of us being on the floor, instead, it was better for both of us to be standing. I guess I didn’t think that part through. I improvise, just raining down punch after punch until his head rolls to the side and all of his fight disappears. <<elseif $style is "Kenpo">>\ I immediately surge forward, striking him two times in his stomach and then placing a perfectly timed palm strike to his face when he sits up. As soon as his head goes back, hitting the ground, I strike his face again and then get to my feet, stomping his head next. <<elseif $style is "Taekwondo">>\ This wasn’t my ideal position for fighting, but there was little I can do. I crawl back just enough to give my leg the necessary room it needs to execute the move I was envisioning. The man sits up and is about to lunge for me when I push up, and then kick my leg out. The force of my leg whips across his face, sending him straight back to the ground. It probably wasn’t hard enough to crack his neck or anything, but he would be out for some time. <<elseif $style is "Judo">>\ I roll over him so that I was in the position to use a chokehold move. While wrapping one of my legs around his midsection, one hand reaches out and grabs his thigh, the other settling on his collar. I apply pressure to this, and though the action is slow, he slowly loses all fight and his head rolls to the side. <<else>>\ I immediately move on top of him and begin raining down punches, not giving him a second to put his guard fully up. I keep it coming, watching as his face begins to turn from its usual peachy tone to one of red. My actions leave multicolored bruises on his face and my fists. His blood stains my fingers, and only when his guard totally goes down do I stop. His head rolls to the side, and I get to my feet, just now realizing that I was breathing harshly. <</if>>\ [[Continue->FC1]]After some searching, I spot a decent pile of feces next to me. It was sick, but it would give me some much-needed time. Just don’t think about it, I tell myself and reach out and grab it. I chuck it straight at the man’s face and with his attention elsewhere, race to my gun. I grab it with my cleaner hand and take the shot, the bullet soaring through his chest. He takes two more steps before falling face first to the floor. [[Continue->FC1]] <<nobr>> <<set $zillah -=3>> <<endnobr>> I pistol whip her, rolling my eyes at the long speech that she probably had prepared for me. I’ll let Syd kill her, I still wasn’t comfortable with the idea of taking another’s life. “You’re such a weak and pathetic little thing,” the Entity sighs, their words echoing off the sides of my head. I mentally tell them to shut up before putting my attention on the rest of the room. I still had the man to deal with. <<if $cp>>\ “Hey, could use some help over here!” Chris shouts, and I look just in time to see his body get flung across the room. <</if>>\ The man is upon me before I can plan my next moves, he grabs my wrist and wrestles the gun out of my hands, it goes skidding across the floor, almost falling into one of the holes. Great. <<if $cp>>\ “Busy!” I shout back. <</if>>\ I try to shove the man off of me, but his grip is unyielding, in one smooth move, he lifts me up and tosses me over his shoulder. I hear his footsteps, carrying them towards me. I gaze around, searching for anything to give me an advantage. [[Lunge towards him.]] [[Use the ... animal droppings.]] [[Put more space between us.]]<<nobr>> <<set $zillah +=3>> <<endnobr>> I aim and shoot, my heart lurching just a little at the sight and feeling. Like last time, a small piece of me comes alive, it revels in the sensation. It wasn’t necessarily the act of taking a life that awakens this half of me, more so the act of being around a new soul who has walked across the veil. “Hmm, it tastes nice, doesn’t it?” the Entity questions, their low laugh giving me a slight headache. I mentally tell them to shut up before putting my attention on the rest of the room. I still had the man to deal with. <<if $cp>>\ “Hey, could use some help over here!” Chris shouts, and I look just in time to see his body get flung across the room. <</if>>\ The man is upon me before I can plan my next moves, he grabs my wrist and wrestles the gun out of my hands, it goes skidding across the floor, almost falling into one of the holes. Great. <<if $cp>>\ “Busy!” I shout back. <</if>>\ I try to shove the man off of me, but his grip is unyielding, in one smooth move, he lifts me up and tosses me over his shoulder. I hear his footsteps, carrying them towards me. I gaze around, searching for anything to give me an advantage. [[Lunge towards him.]] [[Use the ... animal droppings.]] [[Put more space between us.]]I get to my feet and take numerous steps back, continuing to go until I feel the wall behind me. Backing up was no longer an option. The only direction now was forward, though I guess I could go to the side, but that only leads to the hallway where Sydero and the old woman fights. <<if $style is "Aikido">>\ I let the man come to me, blocking the two punches that he sends my way. On the third punch, I block it and then grab his fist, using my free hand to come down on the cubital part of his arm. He falls to his knees, easily allowing me to straighten out his hand and push him farther down. I put my knee on the back of his neck and take advantage of his exposed pressure point. <<elseif $style is "Kenpo">>\ I immediately surge forward, striking him two times in his stomach and then placing a perfectly timed palm strike to his face, shoving him hard enough so that he falls to the ground. As soon as his head goes back, hitting the ground, I strike his face again and then get to my feet, stomping his head next. <<elseif $style is "Taekwondo">>\ He continues to come towards me, and when he gets close enough, I deliver a high-powered and precise kick to the side of his face. A teacher would probably scold me on my stance and other areas, but the kick did what I needed it to do. The man falls to the ground with a large thump. <<elseif $style is "Judo">>\ I walk towards him and once close enough, hook my leg under his to throw off his balance. I throw all of my weight onto him and place my elbow near his collarbone, as we head down I let gravity do the rest, timing when I apply pressure. I do it as soon as he hits, and his body does a slight bounce back up, my elbow keeping him down. I hear air, and a surprised groan escape him, but he doesn’t get back up. <<else>>\ As soon as he gets into striking distance, I hit him with two jabs and then, upon seeing an opening, an uppercut. He stumbles back, and I push on, throwing out more punches until my actions leave multicolored bruises on his face and my fists. His blood stains my fingers, and only when his guard totally goes down do I stop. His body hits the floor, and I flex out my sore fist. <</if>>\ [[Continue->FC1]] I could always use my environment. There were furniture and other objects all around the room. Obstacles that she wouldn’t be able to maneuver around so well. I shoot towards a lone table with plates, and other items on it – items that I didn’t want to know the name of. I grab the plate and toss it toward her, watching as she dodges it with finesse. She begins to round the table, and I play the game of moving at the same time. She realizes this and chuckles, jumping on top of the table. Without doing much thinking, I push the table as hard as I can, watching as she falls on her face. The man is getting closer, I needed to deal with her quickly. [[Knock her out.]] [[Shoot her.]] I had learned the move by messing with my gun and then testing it out on Sydero, who actually was impressed. I trip the guy and put space between him and me, putting my gun on safety before aiming for the woman and taking the shot. Of course, nothing happens, but she didn’t know that. She dodges the invisible bullet, and in those few seconds, valuable seconds that give me an opening while her body still adjusted to the dodge, I take my second shot. My finger flips the safety back off, and I aim for her leg, hitting her shin straight on. She screams in agony as she goes down, lunging out and bringing her leg closer to her. Hopefully, she didn’t have some insta-heal potion, because I had to deal with her friend now. <<if $cp>>\ “Hey, could use some help over here!” Chris shouts, and I look just in time to see his body get flung across the room. <</if>>\ The man is upon me before I can plan my next moves, he grabs my wrist and wrestles the gun out of my hands, it goes skidding across the floor, almost falling into one of the holes. Great. <<if $cp>>\ “Busy!” I shout back. <</if>>\ I try to shove the man off of me, but his grip is unyielding, in one smooth move, he lifts me up and tosses me over his shoulder. I hear his footsteps, carrying him towards me. I gaze around, searching for anything to give me an advantage. [[Lunge towards him.]] [[Use the ... animal droppings.]] [[Put more space between us.]]<<if $cp>>\ The building is again quiet, all the witches and warlocks taken care of. I go to Chris’s side, mostly since I couldn’t find where Sydero was. “Good job,” I say, helping him to his feet. “Yea, no thanks to you.” “Seriously?” I had to deal with two to your one, I couldn’t just drop everything to come and save your butt.” “Your two didn’t even have powers, mine was tossing me around the room like I was her personal punching bag.” [[“Sounds like a personal problem.”]] [[“Actually mine did, she had supernatural agility.”]] [[“Well, nothing I can do about it now.”]] <<else>>\ The building is again quiet, all the witches and warlocks taken care of. I approach some of the bodies to make sure they were down for good, mostly since I couldn’t find where Sydero was. “I feel like I threw out my own back trying to put that old bag down,” Sydero states, coming back in, her hand on her hip. I don’t say anything to her as I continue checking the bodies. That, and Sydero had made a good point a few hunts ago – looting bodies was not something that only video game characters do. While I check bodies, Sydero approaches the reversed pentagram with interest. “This coven wasn’t made up by some amateur witches who didn’t know what they were doing,” Sydero starts. She crouches down and lightly traces her fingers over the pentagram. “Yea, they were the real deal.” [[“Which is a good thing, right?”]] [[“Why do you say that?”]] [[“Sounds like killing them wasn’t enough.”]] <</if>>\“Sounds like a personal problem,” I huff, rolling my eyes at whatever he was about to say next. He attempts to come up with something to say but in the end fails, grumbling about something. “I feel like I threw out my own back trying to put that old bag down,” Sydero states, coming back in, her hand on her hip. She raises a brow at the tension between Chris and me, looking back and forth in interest. “And what did I just interrupt?” [[“Chris is just throwing another, ‘woe is me’ fit.”]] [[“Nothing, what’s next?”]] [[“Chris is mad that I didn’t help him.”]] [[Ignore both of them and walk off.]]“Nope, mine actually did. The woman had supernatural agility,” I correct. He gasps in mock shock, slapping his face gently to further dramatize his thoughts, “oh, you poor thing, she was too fast for you. Well, that changes everything.” “Seriously?” I question, failing to see why he was acting this way. “I feel like I threw out my own back trying to put that old bag down,” Sydero states, coming back in, her hand on her hip. She raises a brow at the tension between Chris and me, looking back and forth in interest. “And what did I just interrupt?” [[“Chris is just throwing another, ‘woe is me’ fit.”]] [[“Nothing, what’s next?”]] [[“Chris is mad that I didn’t help him.”]] [[Ignore both of them and walk off.]]I shrug, rolling my neck as well, “there’s nothing I can do about it now.” “That’s what you choose to reply with? Really?” Chris asks, and I sigh, tired and not feeling like getting into this. “I feel like I threw out my own back trying to put that old bag down,” Sydero states, coming back in, her hand on her hip. She raises a brow at the tension between Chris and me, looking back and forth in interest. “And what did I just interrupt?” [[“Chris is just throwing another, ‘woe is me’ fit.”]] [[“Nothing, what’s next?”]] [[“Chris is mad that I didn’t help him.”]] [[Ignore both of them and walk off.]]“Chris is just throwing another, ‘woe is me’ fit,” I tell her, throwing a sneer Chris’s way. “Give it a break,” he tells me, his attention now on Sydero, “I asked for help, and no one came.” “You were fighting one person, Chris,” she snorts, and I clap as my way of agreeing. “Thank you, Syd!” “Still, Roe, you could’ve helped out a bit, I mean he was being flung around like a ragdoll.” I stop celebrating, glaring at her as she walks back to the reversed pentagram. “This coven wasn’t made up by some amateur witches who didn’t know what they were doing,” Sydero starts. She crouches down and lightly traces her fingers over the pentagram. “Yea, they were the real deal.” [[“Which is a good thing, right?”]] [[“Why do you say that?”]] [[“Sounds like killing them wasn’t enough.”]]“Nothing, what’s next? Are we done here?” I question, watching as Sydero abandons our side and approaches the reversed pentagram with interest. “This coven wasn’t made up by some amateur witches who didn’t know what they were doing,” Sydero starts. She crouches down and lightly traces her fingers over the pentagram. “Yea, they were the real deal.” [[“Which is a good thing, right?”]] [[“Why do you say that?”]] [[“Sounds like killing them wasn’t enough.”]]“Chris is mad that I didn’t help him,” I tell her straight up, no anger or much of any other kind of emotion in my voice. “You were fighting one person, Chris,” she snorts, and I clap as my way of agreeing. “Thank you, Syd!” “Still, Roe, you could’ve helped out a bit, I mean he was being flung around like a ragdoll.” I stop celebrating, glaring at her as she walks back to the reversed pentagram. “This coven wasn’t made up by some amateur witches who didn’t know what they were doing,” Sydero starts. She crouches down and lightly traces her fingers over the pentagram. “Yea, they were the real deal.” [[“Which is a good thing, right?”]] [[“Why do you say that?”]] [[“Sounds like killing them wasn’t enough.”]]I don’t answer her, and I pay no more mind to Chris. Instead, I turn on my heel and approach the supposedly dead bodies, nothing wrong with making sure. That and Sydero had made a good point a few hunts ago – looting bodies were not something that only video game characters do. While I check bodies, Sydero approaches the reversed pentagram with interest. “This coven wasn’t made up by some amateur witches who didn’t know what they were doing,” Sydero starts. She crouches down and lightly traces her fingers over the pentagram. “Yea, they were the real deal.” [[“Which is a good thing, right?”]] [[“Why do you say that?”]] [[“Sounds like killing them wasn’t enough.”]]“Uh, that’s a good thing, right? I mean, we were able to take them out, and that’s good for us.” “I suppose,” she shrugs, grabbing the body closest to her and ripping off part of her shirt. With the fabric in hand, she begins to wipe whatever material was used to make the pentagram. She breaks the symbol and motions to follow her out. We were done with this, and that’s all that I could hope for. Despite my tiredness, I have a small skip in my step as we walk back to the car and then drive to the motel. There’s only one thing that could make me happier, and when we get back to the motel, we find it sitting on the table waiting. “Sorry, I was hungry,” Bradley snickers as the rest of us instantly see what is left. I grab some nuggets and fries, grabbing a book as I go to the bed I had claimed. Bradley grabs a pack of cards and sits at the table, “did it all go well?” “Yea, good intel by the way. How’d you track them?” Sydero asks, grabbing a seat while she eats her fries. “It was pure luck, I connected dots from their last home, it was the only way I realized what and who they were. They kept their noses down mostly, I mean I easily figured out they were witches, but if it weren’t for that one slip up, I would’ve never known.” [[“We would’ve gotten them either way.”]] [[“To think, they would’ve gotten away otherwise.”]]“Why do you say that?” I question. “I mean, as you know, they're using baby blood.” “Why is that? Sheep’s blood or something wouldn’t have worked?” “It would’ve, but baby blood is pure, and whoever’s attention you’re trying to capture, you capture quickly. You have to be seriously devoted to use baby blood,” she tells me, grabbing the body closest to her and ripping off part of her shirt. With the fabric in hand, she begins to wipe whatever material was used to make the pentagram. She breaks the symbol and motions to follow her out. We were done with this, and that’s all that I could hope for. Despite my tiredness, I have a small skip in my step as we walk back to the car and then drive to the motel. There’s only one thing that could make me happier, and when we get back to the motel, we find it sitting on the table waiting. “Sorry, I was hungry,” Bradley snickers as the rest of us instantly see what is left. I grab some nuggets and fries, grabbing a book as I go to the bed I had claimed. Bradley grabs a pack of cards and sits at the table, “did it all go well?” “Yea, good intel by the way. How’d you track them?” Sydero asks, grabbing a seat while she eats her fries. “It was pure luck, I connected dots from their last home, it was the only way I realized what and who they were. They kept their noses down mostly, I mean I easily figured out they were witches, but if it weren’t for that one slip up, I would’ve never known.” [[“We would’ve gotten them either way.”]] [[“To think, they would’ve gotten away otherwise.”]]“You make it sound like killing them wasn’t enough,” I remark. “No, it’s fine. Doesn’t really matter much now anyway, they’re all dead,” she tells me, grabbing the body closest to her and ripping off part of her shirt. With the fabric in hand, she begins to wipe the material that was used to make the pentagram. She breaks the symbol and motions for me to follow her out. We were done with this, and that’s all that I could hope for. Despite my tiredness, I have a small skip in my step as we walk back to the car and then drive to the motel. I grab some nuggets and fries, grabbing a book as I go to the bed I had claimed. Bradley grabs a pack of cards and sits at the table, “did it all go well?” “Yea, good intel by the way. How’d you track them?” Sydero asks, grabbing a seat while she eats her fries. “It was pure luck, I connected dots from their last home, it was the only way I realized what and who they were. They kept their noses down mostly, I mean I easily figured out they were witches, but if it weren’t for that one slip up, I would’ve never known.” [[“We would’ve gotten them either way.”]] [[“To think, they would’ve gotten away otherwise.”]]<<nobr>> <<set $Alyrian = true>> <<set $sympathy -=2>> <<set $sydero -=3>> <<endnobr>> “Doesn’t matter if they slipped up or not, we would’ve gotten them either way,” I tell him while trying to find my spot in the book. “But they would’ve seemed innocent,” Bradley reminds me, and I shrug, finally finding my spot and getting comfortable. “Monsters are monsters.” I catch sight of Sydero side-eyeing me, eyes narrowed before she puts them back on Bradley. <<if $cp>>\ Moments like this had become increasingly rare. As soon as we left Sydero’s safehouse and done our first hunt as ‘more trained’ hunters, we’ve been on hunt after hunt. Half of the reason we were on the move was that of the police. They weren’t giving up on me, and it had made the job harder for us. Another reason was that we needed the money. When you had four mouths to feed, house, and keep up with – money wasn’t the easiest thing to keep. Most of the hunts we’ve been on have been just that, hunts. Sydero wanting Chris and me to get more acquainted to the job before attempting to take on a specialist job. <<else>>\ Moments like this had become increasingly rare. Can you imagine them still alive? Who knows how many people they killed,” Bradley says, shuddering at the thought before focusing back on the cards. <<if $cp>>\ Moments like this had become increasingly rare.
